title: newRegistered Massage Therapist/RMT
description:
Job Description

Kefi Wellness Centre, located in Oakville, Ontario, is looking for a registered massage therapist who is passionate about maintaining patients’ physical well-being and will be responsible for but not limited to helping relieve patients’ pain, recover from injuries, and improve patients’ mobility. The Massage Therapist will work within a multidisciplinary setting alongside physiotherapists, chiropractors, acupuncturists, and osteopathic manual practitioners.

About Us

Kefi wellness centre is a newly established multidisciplinary clinic located in Oakville, Ontario. We aim to provide evidence-based treatment to our patients with patient-centred care. We want to partner with our patients that take a proactive and preventative approach to maintain a higher quality of life.

Job Duties

  • Assess the root cause of pain
  • Knead and massage muscles and soft tissues
  • Utilize a range of manipulation techniques to reduce pain
  • Keep organized and confidential records of patient health and treatment options
  • Communicate clearly with patients in explaining the causes of their pain
  • Suggest strengthening exercises for patients to complete at home
  • Collaborate with other health care providers to ensure patients receive the best quality care
  • Promote relaxation for clients to ensure the maximum benefit of the massage
  • Maintain a healthy and safe environment
  • Comply with all regulations

Requirements

  • An active member in good standing with CMTO
  • Liability insurance
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Must be organized and keep excellent records
  • Must be patient and understanding
  • Able to work independently and also able to collaborate with other practitioners.
  • Able to generate and conduct effective treatment plans for patients

Bonus Perks

  • New graduates are welcome to apply
  • Up to $1000 signing bonus
  • Negotiable competitive percent split
  • Flexible schedules and hours
  • All necessary supplies (sheets, needles, clinical supplies)
  • Onsite gym for rehabilitation
  • Cutting-edge modalities
  • Jane app booking system
  • Direct Billing to insurance companies
  • Staff rated therapies
  • In house laundry
  • Onsite free parking
  • Medical centre with family doctors next door
  • Professional marketing with social media, and advertising

Working Conditions

  • Close physical contact with patients
  • Prolonged periods of standing
  • Repetitive motions

Kefi Wellness Centre is an equal opportunity employer, and we thank everyone for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted. In keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations are available throughout the recruitment and selection process and will be provided upon request.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $55.00-$65.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Active membership in good standing with CMTO (required)
  • Liability insurance (required)

Expected start date: 2022-05-30

title: Certified Reflexologist (CR)
description:
Certified Reflexologist – Full Time and Part Time

Now hiring Certified Reflexologists at Massage Addict Belleville clinic located at busy Quinte Mall.

Massage Addict is Canada’s first and largest membership-based massage therapy provider with over 95 clinics and more than 1400 RMTs, Acupuncturists and Certified Reflexologists across the country. Visit our website to learn more about us at www.massageaddict.ca.

Our professional, clean and well-established clinic is looking for Part Time and Full Time Certified Reflexologists. The ideal candidate is professional, has exceptional customer service skills, a passion for improving the health of Canadians and is motivated to work collaboratively within a team of other health care practitioners.

Our clinic has 7 treatment rooms and is located in a high-traffic, convenient retail plaza alongside other well-known national brands. Massage Addict offers a membership program, which allows members to enhance health through regular monthly treatments and, at the same time, allows us to have a consistent client base.

Join our team. We will fill your schedule so you can focus solely on providing high quality treatments.

What we offer

· Positive, fun and professional work environment

· Clinical approach to treatments – in a friendly and inviting atmosphere

· Comprehensive and competitive compensation package

· Flexible schedules to meet work-life balance

· Linens, supplies, on-site laundry, billing/booking services and full time reception provided

· Optional health-care benefits package

Responsibilities

· Perform high-quality reflexology treatments with a complete focus on the client

· Maintain a clean treatment room

· Recommend treatment plans

· Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records

· Work collaboratively in a team environment while upholding the clinic processes and procedures

Qualifications and Requirements

· Applicants must be certified and members in good standing with a recognized Reflexology association

· Reflexology certificate

· A positive, professional, and flexible attitude

· Ability to work in a team environment with other Health Care Professionals

· Desire to build and grow within your profession

If you are a Certified Reflexologist, with a passion for improving the health of Canadians, looking to work in an upbeat professional, and well-established clinic then we would love to hear from you. We invite you to contact us today to discuss the details.

We thank all applicants but only those qualified will be contacted.

Massage Addict is proud to partner with The Arthritis Society.

Job Type: Part-time

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

title: newRegistered Massage Therapist
description:
About Us

We are a group of Award-Winning Boutique Wellness Clinics located in Canada and Caribbean. Our focus is Preventative Health, and we work with top medical practitioners to offer services that are aimed at healthy living. We bridge the gap between traditional and alternative medicine to help prevent, heal, and manage the disease while boosting vitality. Our clinics deliver a multi-faceted approach to optimizing your health and slowing down aging, including a variety of health and beauty products and services. We were one of the first clinics in Canada to truly embrace and execute the concept of integrative care through cross-collaboration and building synergies amongst various practitioners. We are now in our 9th year of operations and look forward to many more.

We currently own and operate the following clinics. For more information about us and our clinics please visit – www.thewellnesscorp.ca

  • BeWell @ Clarkson Health Clinic, South Mississauga
  • BeWell @ Hamilton Health Clinic, Corktown – Hamilton
  • BeWell Health Clinic, Toronto
  • EatWell Health Centre, Toronto
  • Simcoe Place Health Clinic, Toronto
  • Vitality Medical Clinic, Punta Cana

BeWell Health Clinic is led by Psychiatrists, the team is comprised of Psychologists, Psychotherapists, Social Workers, Naturopathic Doctors, Acupuncturists, Mindfulness & Breath Coaches, RMTs, and many more all housed in one state of the art facility. Our model of care is truly integrative where all practitioners work closely with each other to reach the best patient outcomes.

The Role

The clinic offers an excellent work environment. Our client base consists mainly of professionals from surrounding companies, most of whom are looking for deep tissue massage from a knowledgeable therapist. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered care and are looking for someone who is friendly and able to quickly build rapport. We are committed to quality patient-centered care, leading clinical practices, and collaborative teamwork. We are supportive, respectful, caring, and accountable toward our patients and staff.

Main job duties would be as follows:

  • Provide therapeutic massages to patients by appointments
  • Review patient’s medical history and note any medical conditions
  • Determine the type of massage best suited for the patient.
  • Provide appropriate treatment to the patients based on their needs, goals, and preferences.
  • Communicate warmly, effectively, positively, and professionally with patients.
  • Utilizing e-charting software to document treatment sessions and recommendations.
  • Collaborating with the inter-professional team at the clinic
  • Managing caseload in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead clients through individualized care plans - accurately assessing, communicating, and providing hands-on treatment to facilitate goal attainment for the client.
  • Engage in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Advise clients of stretching, strengthening or relaxation methods
  • work closely with other practitioners and are motivated to grow their practice.

Qualification

  • Must be registered and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Excellent clinical knowledge
  • Create a custom treatment plan for each patient -inclusive of maintenance programs when necessary
  • Friendly with exceptional interpersonal skills, build rapport quickly
  • Educate patients on other services provided by the Clinic
  • Stays up to date on new techniques and relevant offerings
  • Reliable +professional with a strong work ethic

Why Us?

  • Competitive split OR base salary offered while you grow your practice.
  • All supplies provided by the Clinic (linens, oil/lotions/gel)
  • Flexible working schedule
  • Large existing practice
  • Great Administrative support
  • Warm and personable team-based atmosphere
  • A fast-growing company with lots of growth potential
  • Lumino Health Marketing provided
  • Complimentary services at the clinic ($2000 value)
  • Skincare and wellness products at cost (Hello SkinCeuticals!!)

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $40.00-$60.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

title: newRegistered Massage Therapist
description:
Vibrant Healing Inc. is a multidisciplinary clinic in South Barrie which is currently staffed with chiropractors, Acupuncturist and Registered Massage Therapists. We strive in providing the community with leading solutions to achieve optimal physical health through individually customized care. Providing up to date unparalleled health care is what sets us above the rest. We pride ourselves on providing services which set the president on patient centered care. Peak optimal health and wellbeing for every individual is our mantra.

We currently provide massage therapy, chiropractic care, laser therapy and acupuncture services at the clinic with direct billing available for all services. There is an immediate need at the clinic to take over a full case load of massage therapy clients. On top of already having such a large client base with the clinic reaching its 12th year of establishment the clinic is also averaging 10 new massage therapy patients a month.

This is a great opportunity for a new graduate or for an established Massage Therapist. Mentoring and practice building skills will be provided for new graduates. Successful candidates will have strong social skills and need to be able to work in a fast paced environment to accommodate the high volume of clients. Laundry and sheets, as well as billing, scheduling and advertising services are all available and provided for the massage therapist at the clinic. The average incomes of the massage therapist at the clinic is from $85,000 to $105,000 a year approx. based on percentage split. Room rental is also available.

The current shift we have available at the clinic include: Monday to Saturday's; Mornings and Evenings.

If you believe you would be a strong candidate for this position please e-mail your resume along with a cover letter.

The position is available immediately.

Graduating class of 2022 is welcome to apply.

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: Full Time Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Busy Multidisciplinary Clinic Seeking Full-Time RMT To Join Our Team - New Patients Guaranteed!

So, you love what you do. Now love where you work!

Come be part of our amazing multidisciplinary team, as we look to hire a Full Time Massage Therapist for our Dartmouth location. Opportunities also available in our Bedford and Fall River locations.

At Choice Health Centre, we are a multi-disciplinary health care clinic with a vision to change healthcare in Nova Scotia by focusing on patient results, effective therapies, patient education, and one-on-one care for the management of musculoskeletal conditions and overall health and wellness.

As a result of our accelerated growth and the high demand for quality musculoskeletal care, Choice Health Centre is looking for practitioners who are team oriented, open-minded, self-accountable, and motivated by providing a premium patient experience while continuously working towards getting superior patient results. Oh, and likes to have fun while doing so!

We strive to provide an exceptional work environment and atmosphere, as well as provide all the services, tools, and assistance you need to grow your caseload, improve your skills and provide a balanced work/home life!

The position has the following benefits:

✔ Competitive Split-Fee Compensation With Incentives

✔ Paid Vacation & Stat Holidays

✔ Continuing Education Allowance

✔ Clinical and Business Mentorship

✔ Option for Medical and Dental Benefits

✔ PPE & Supplies Provided

✔ Online Booking, Charting, and Scheduling System

✔ Business Cards & Other Marketing Materials

✔ Leadership & Partnership Opportunities

✔ Guaranteed new patients from clinic’s marketing and online/social media advertising

✔ Guaranteed referrals as you work as part of our collaborative team alongside Chiropractors, Physiotherapists, Massage Therapists, Acupuncturists, Osteopath, Naturopath, and more

Ability to work Evenings are encouraged for faster caseload growth. New grads are welcome to apply.

Check us out and meet our team at choicehealthcentre.com

Our Dartmouth location is at 560 Windmill Dr.

To apply, please email your resume and cover letter.

Thank you for your interest!

title: Massage Therapist (RMT) - Guaranteed Wages, Benefits, Safety...
description:
$34,444 - $96,688 a year - Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, Contract, Permanent

Apply now

With Covid and Quarantine I know the road to becoming a RMT has been hard, and I hope to make the final step a bit easier through new grad incentives and financial support.

Even in the challenging times upon us, we have expertly adapted our safety protocols in order to keep offering the same level of service in a safe, comfortable atmosphere.

  • We have implemented rotational sanitation procedures for all common surfaces, multiple times throughout the day.
  • We provide PPE for therapists and clients.
  • We have implemented pre-screening for clients and staff and adapted our day-to-day clinic protocols and procedures to keep us all safe.

Leave the admin to us. Our clinics are modern, professional, welcoming, and convenient. Your clinic support team will focus on filling your schedule and providing all the in-clinic support you need. You’ll focus 100% on providing the very best treatment for your clients while earning an attractive, predictable income.

Benefits:

  • We provide all supplies, PPE, billing, booking services as well as full-time reception coverage.
  • Immediate client base waiting for you
  • Flexible schedules to meet the work-life balance
  • Access to online booking system – monitor your schedule from your phone
  • Comprehensive and enhanced compensation package - Predictable bi-weekly income
  • Paid time off
  • Optional health-care benefits package / Retirement Package
  • Optional programs to assist with the cost of registration/licensing
  • We have a new digital continuing education platform for our RMTs that offers free and unlimited access to the Dexterity Professional Development online learning platform with over 17 advanced courses.

As our very first regulated health profession, we built our foundation on massage therapy; here we are, more than 12 years later, and our RMTs now work alongside with doctors of chiropractic, acupuncturists and reflexologists to offer integrative therapeutic services to our clients. If you are interested in working in a client-focused team atmosphere, we would love to hear from you.

Enhanced sanitation and client screening.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
About Us


We are a group of Award-Winning Boutique Wellness Clinics located in Canada and Caribbean. Our focus is Preventative Health, and we work with top medical practitioners to offer services that are aimed at healthy living. We bridge the gap between traditional and alternative medicine to help prevent, heal, and manage the disease while boosting vitality. Our clinics deliver a multi-faceted approach to optimizing your health and slowing down aging, including a variety of health and beauty products and services. We were one of the first clinics in Canada to truly embrace and execute the concept of integrative care through cross-collaboration and building synergies amongst various practitioners. We are now in our 9th year of operations and look forward to many more.

We currently own and operate the following clinics. For more information about us and our clinics please visit – www.thewellnesscorp.ca

  • BeWell @ Clarkson Health Clinic, South Mississauga
  • BeWell @ Hamilton Health Clinic, Corktown – Hamilton
  • BeWell Health Clinic, Toronto
  • EatWell Health Centre, Toronto
  • Simcoe Place Health Clinic, Toronto
  • Vitality Medical Clinic, Punta Cana

BeWell Health Clinic is a multidisciplinary health clinic led by Psychiatrists, the team is comprised of MDs, Psychologists, Psychotherapists, Social Workers, Naturopathic Doctors, Acupuncturists, Mindfulness & Breath Coaches, RMTs, and many more all housed in one state of the art facility. Our model of care is truly integrative where all practitioners work closely with each other to reach the best patient outcomes.

The Role

The clinic offers an excellent work environment. Our client base consists mainly of professionals from surrounding companies, most of whom are looking for deep tissue massage from a knowledgeable therapist. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered care and are looking for someone who is friendly and able to quickly build rapport. We are committed to quality patient-centered care, leading clinical practices, and collaborative teamwork. We are supportive, respectful, caring, and accountable toward our patients and staff.

Main job duties would be as follows:

  • Provide therapeutic massages to patients by appointments
  • Review patient’s medical history and note any medical conditions
  • Determine the type of massage best suited for the patient.
  • Provide appropriate treatment to the patients based on their needs, goals, and preferences.
  • Communicate warmly, effectively, positively, and professionally with patients.
  • Utilizing e-charting software to document treatment sessions and recommendations.
  • Collaborating with the inter-professional team at the clinic
  • Managing caseload in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead clients through individualized care plans - accurately assessing, communicating, and providing hands-on treatment to facilitate goal attainment for the client.
  • Engage in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Advise clients of stretching, strengthening or relaxation methods
  • work closely with other practitioners and are motivated to grow their practice.

Qualification

  • Must be registered and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Excellent clinical knowledge
  • Create a custom treatment plan for each patient -inclusive of maintenance programs when necessary
  • Friendly with exceptional interpersonal skills, build rapport quickly
  • Educate patients on other services provided by the Clinic
  • Stays up to date on new techniques and relevant offerings
  • Reliable +professional with a strong work ethic

Why Us?

  • Competitive split OR base salary offered while you grow your practice.
  • All supplies provided by the Clinic (linens, oil/lotions/gel)
  • Flexible working schedule
  • Large existing practice
  • Great Administrative support
  • Warm and personable team-based atmosphere
  • A fast-growing company with lots of growth potential
  • Lumino Health Marketing provided
  • Complimentary services at the clinic ($2000 value)
  • Skincare and wellness products at cost (Hello SkinCeuticals!!)

title: Soon-to-be Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)
description:
New Clinic in Guelph Opening Soon! North Guelph Speedvale and Stevenson

You will get first choice of what days and times work best for you!

Making the transition from classroom to clinic is an exciting time but choosing a place to practice that meets your needs can sometimes seem overwhelming. Considering options that fit your lifestyle, provide you with work/life balance, support your career growth, recognizes your achievements and is close to home is one of the most important decisions you’ll make.

How we support your success as a future RMT: Our Clinic team provides full administrative support including rent, bookings, billing, and laundry so that you can successfully focus 100% on your clients’ therapeutic needs. Additionally, you’ll be provided with:

  • An established (and growing) client base
  • National, regional, and local marketing campaigns
  • Full-time reception coverage
  • All of your supplies & PPE’s
  • A safe working environment. Health and safety of our entire team is of utmost importance to us, rigorous sanitation and safety protocols routinely and diligently practiced with clinics.

What we offer:

  • Predictable income
  • Flexible scheduling that works for you
  • No non-compete
  • Health-care benefits package (optional)
  • Free and unlimited access to the Dexterity online learning platform
  • Students who have signed conditional offers with Massage Addict will have access to the Dexterity courses including the OSCE and MCQ prep course!
  • Continuing education support
  • A collaborative multidisciplinary team who cross-refers clients within the clinic
  • For New Grads: Financial assistance with licensing and registration costs

If you are professional, positive and passionate with a strong work ethic and a dedication to provide high quality treatments to help clients feel their best, please reach out to us!

Locally Owned. Proudly Canadian: We are so proud of our East Coast roots that began, back in 2008, with a massage therapy clinic in Halifax. Over the years, as the market evolved and changed, we also evolved and changed, and grew to 100 clinics operating across the country. Seeing increased demand for additional therapeutic solutions led to the introduction of Reflexology (2018), Acupuncture (2019), and Chiropractic Care (2020). We provide 65,000+ treatments each month; 83% of which are to help relieve pain or reduce stress and/ or anxiety.

Whether you are a new grad or a experienced practitioner, we would love to chat!

owned and operated by a seasoned acupuncturist that brings a different insight into the business and will always put the therapists first

title: newRegistered Massage Therapist (RMT)
description:
Who we are looking for

Our ideal RMT candidate will relish the opportunity to treat clients alongside other forward-thinking physiotherapists, counsellors, naturopathic doctors, acupuncturists and kinesiologists as part of our integrated team.

You are able to work and learn collaboratively with multi-disciplinary practitioners, willing to give back to grass-roots charity events, and have a passion for sharpening and expanding your education.

Ideal candidates will have a strong background in many styles of massage, including, but not limited to, Swedish Massage Therapy, Deep Tissue Massage, Neuromuscular Therapy, Myofascial Release Therapy and Muscle Energy Techniques (MET)

While we value applicants with additional skill sets or specializations in sports massage, TMJ, cranial-sacral, oncology massage, and pre/post natal/pregnancy massage these are not necessarily required as we encourage new graduates with interest in these additional specializations to apply.

Our Neighbourhood

Forge Health is located adjacent to the Holdom Skytrain Station in North Burnaby, minutes away from the rapidly expanding Brentwood / Lougheed Hwy corridor with ample parking and seamless accessibility and walk by foot traffic.

What we bring to the table

  • A full caseload
  • 70-75% compensation split, depending on the number of days in the clinic.
  • A comprehensive group benefits extended health plan
  • Professional development, mentorship and education allowance
  • Private direct billing and ICBC; no WCB
  • Help building clientele through clinic branding strategies
  • Full time admin staff with Jane EMR software
  • Full laundry services on site
  • A work culture like no other; focussed on professional growth, work/life balance, community and family
  • Fitness perks, socials and team camaraderie

About Forge Health

We are a boutique rehab and sport clinic fuelled by a fierce dedication to what we do. We bring a pioneering spirit in how we practice physiotherapy, massage therapy, acupuncture, kinesiology, clinical counselling, naturopathic medicine, fitness and sport performance.

title: newRegistered Massage Therapist
description:
We have an opening for an RMT team member at our Yates St. location in Victoria, BC! We have grown organically for 17 years in response to community needs. All of our RMT's are fully booked and we are looking for someone that can help with our new patients and waitlists. Come and join our team of RMT's, Physiotherapists, Chiropractors, Kinesiologists and Acupuncturists in beautiful Victoria, BC!

Everything is provided and managed to ensure that you will have a busy and rewarding practice:

  • full time reception
  • fully booked schedule
  • direct billing
  • hydraulic tables
  • linen/laundry
  • cream
  • online booking/charting (Janeapp)
  • marketing
  • bookkeeping
  • business and clinical mentorship

We are an Award Winning, established, busy clinic. We have won Victoria's Top Choice for Massage Therapy four times, have been one of Victoria's 3 Best Rated Massage Therapy clinics for 6 years in a row!

We are looking for a team player that enjoys being part of a large collaborative multidisciplinary group. Therapeutic massage and an interest in providing therapeutic treatments is a must. This position is suitable for a new grad with the right skills. We provide mentorship in clinical practice and business, and skills nights for all practitioners to come together to learn in a relaxed environment. Our locations are open 7 days per week and have a variety of 8-2, 2:30-8:45 weekday and weekend shifts.

Leave the business tasks to us; we provide a full service administrative team so that you can focus on being an RMT, and enjoy yourself when you're not working. Find the balance in your life : ) The therapists that join us are full from the start!

Strong communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills, and an innate need to offer an exceptional patient experience is essential. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
We continue to follow all guidelines as set out by the CMTBC, the BC Health Authority and WSBC. Our priority is keeping our practitioners, patients and support staff healthy and safe.

Application question(s):

  • Are you registered with the CMTBC, or awaiting CMTBC board exams or results?

title: Registered Massage Therapist!
description:
At Vitality Chiropractic & Wellness Clinic we take a holistic, mind and body approach to healthcare. We are located in central Calgary close to U of C (16th Ave & Crowchild Trail). We strive on creating a warm, compassionate and friendly team environment where you will be working along with other healthcare professionals. We are looking for a candidate who can thrive working independently, but have the ability to communicate with the different practitioners at the practice.

Job description

Responsibilities:

  • Professional, passionate and a warm positive attitude with a strong work ethic
  • Provide therapeutic/sport massage & relaxation massages as required
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a collaborative environment independently
  • Maintain proficient and clear SOAP notes documenting client condition and progress on provided software Janeapp
  • Talk to clients about symptoms, medical history and desired results of treatment as needed

Other Preferred skill sets:

  • Cupping, Hot Stone, Pre/post Natal massage is preferred but not necessary
  • Provide clients with guidance on stretching, strengthening, overall relaxation, and how to improve their posture as needed
  • No previous work experience is necessary
  • A great full-time or part-time opportunity for someone looking to work 3-6 days a week (Shifts available for every day of the week).

At Vitality Chiropractic & Wellness Clinic we offer:

  • Competitive Percentage
  • Online booking
  • Internal referrals available from collaborative team of Chiropractor, Psychologist, and Acupuncturist.
  • Flexible working hours.

Qualifications:

  • Registered Massage Therapist – 2200 hours and a member in good standing with a provincial association.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 24-40 per week

Salary: $48,000.00-$78,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Day shift

COVID-19 considerations:
-Masks required
-Sanitization practices in place

Licence/Certification:

  • RMT License (preferred)

title: Registered Massage Therapist (RMT) FT and PT
description:
New Clinic in Guelph Opening Soon! North Guelph Speedvale and Stevenson

You will get first choice of what days and times work best for you!

Massage Addict is Canada’s first and largest membership-based network of health and wellness clinics. Join our team and be part of a movement that’s helping to improve the health of Canadians through four therapeutic services: Massage Therapy, Chiropractic Care, Acupuncture and Reflexology.

How we support our Massage Therapists: Our team provides full-service business and administrative support, which includes taking care of the rent, bookings, billing, and laundry so that you can successfully focus 100% on your clients’ therapeutic needs.

  • Flexible scheduling that works for you with a predictable income
  • An established (and growing) client base
  • National, regional, and local marketing campaigns
  • Full-time reception coverage that takes care of all booking and billings
  • All of your supplies & PPE’s
  • Access to the online booking system
  • No non-compete clause
  • Health care benefit package (optional)
  • Free and unlimited access to the Dexterity online learning platform for continuing education
  • A collaborative multidisciplinary team who cross-refers clients within the clinic
  • For new grads: Financial Assistance with licensing/registration costs

What you’ll need to practice at Massage Addict:

  • Registered and a member in good standing with CMTO
  • If you are professional, positive and passionate with a strong work ethic and a dedication to provide high quality treatments to help clients feel their best, please reach out to us!

Locally Owned. Proudly Canadian: We are so proud of our East Coast roots that began, back in 2008, with a massage therapy clinic in Halifax. Over the years, as the market evolved and changed, we also evolved and changed, and grew to 100 clinics operating across the country. Seeing increased demand for additional therapeutic solutions led to the introduction of Reflexology (2018), Acupuncture (2019), and Chiropractic Care (2020)!

https://www.massageaddict.ca/guelph-speedvalestevenson

Whether you are a new grad or a experienced practitioner, we would love to chat!

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Are you looking for a place enjoy your career? Creston PhysioWorks & More is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to join our team 4 days a week.

Our clinic is in the heart of the Kootenays, whether your idea of fun is hiking, cycling, fishing, watersports, disc golf, camping or enjoying amazing local food at local wineries and breweries, Creston is the place for you.

Spring comes early here, Fall seems to last forever and our mild winter is perfect for skiing, snowboarding, ice fishing and snowshoeing!

Creston PhysioWorks & More is looking for an outgoing Registered Massage Therapist to join our team. This position is part of an amazing multi-disciplinary team of OT, PT, Acupuncturist, Clinical Counselling. We service a very wide variety of clientele from, ICBC, RCMP, orthopedic, pediatric, geriatric, etc. We have a full caseload for someone to walk right into as we are booking 8-10 weeks out. Creston PhysioWorks & More is open Monday to Thursday, so all weekends are reserved for you and the adventure you choose!

We offer a signing bonus and a subsidized gym pass (some conditions apply).

Our clinic works with both Associate professionals and professionals that prefer to be an hourly employee. Our compensation packages are very competitive!

New Grads are welcome to apply.

Contact us with you resume

Part-time hours: 28 per week

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Fixed term contract

Salary: From $50.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • No weekends

COVID-19 considerations:
We follow all required Covid 19 health and safety requirements.

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)
description:
Massage Addict is Canada’s first and largest membership-based network of health and wellness clinics. Join our team and be part of a movement that’s helping to improve the health of Canadians through four therapeutic services: Massage Therapy, Chiropractic Care, Acupuncture and Reflexology.

Focus on what you love - helping your clients. We'll take care of the rest.

Our Clinic team provides full administrative support including rent, bookings, billing, and laundry so that you can successfully focus 100% on your clients’ therapeutic needs. Additionally, you’ll be provided with:

  • An established (and growing) client base all year-round
  • Predictable income
  • Flexible scheduling that works for you
  • National, regional, and local marketing campaigns
  • Full-time reception coverage
  • All of your supplies & PPE’s
  • A safe working environment. Health and safety of our entire team is of utmost importance to us, rigorous sanitation and safety protocols routinely and diligently practiced with clinics.

What we offer:

  • An attractive compensation package
  • No non-compete
  • Health-care benefits package (optional)
  • Free and unlimited access to the Dexterity online learning platform
  • Continuing education support
  • A collaborative multidisciplinary team

Locally Owned. Proudly Canadian. Massage Addict is 100% Canadian-owned and operated with more than 100 multidisciplinary clinics across the country. Our 1,600 Doctors of Chiropractic, Registered Massage Therapists, Registered Acupuncturists, and Certified Reflexologists help more than 65,000 Canadians to manage their pain, stress, and anxiety each month.

Since opening the first clinic in 2008, Massage Addict has been helping clients improve their health and wellness through quality therapeutic treatments that are both affordable and convenient. Visit MassageAddict.ca to learn more.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Small Animal Associate Veterinarian with training in Acupunc...
description:
Salary: CAD$100,000 and above DOE

Package: Competitive compensation plus bonus potential, Generous CE allowance, Opportunity to learn hands-on from their hospital’s experienced staff, Access to our network of over 700 DVMs, Medical, dental and vision insurance, Professional liability coverage, Association dues and VIN membership, Outstanding medical and pet supply discounts, Fairness, respect in the workplace, Opportunity for personal, professional and financial growth.

Type of Work: Small Animal Associate Veterinarian with training in Acupuncture and herbal medicine, and a strong commitment to whole food nutrition

Job Details: Located in beautiful Nova Scotia, this is the longest standing holistic veterinary medicine service in the Halifax Regional Municipality. Nicknamed as the “City of Lakes” due to the 23 lakes that can be found within its borders, this team is proud to play an important role in the lives of its pet-passionate residents. Their friendly and welcoming people, combined with the picturesque natural landscapes around, provide them with plenty of inspiration and recreational opportunities.

This hospital has been an established part of the community for over 20 years with a focus on Traditional Chinese Veterinary Medicine (TCVM) including Acupuncture and Chinese herbals, and Canine Rehabilitation. In addition to the aforementioned areas of focus, they offer a wide array of services such as Chiropractic care, Bowen therapy, hydrotherapy, underwater treadmill therapy, massage therapy, low-level laser therapy, neuromuscular stimulation, in depth nutritional consultations (whole food for cats and dogs), and so much more! They can provide guidance on unique approaches to typical pet health care issues.

They are currently looking for a veterinarian with training in Acupuncture and herbal medicine, and a strong commitment to whole food nutrition. The Hospital operates as a referral practice to provide high-quality, unique services to enhance and go beyond conventional veterinary care.

Come join their DVMs who, with the help of a dedicated, professional and experienced support team of rehab certified and holistically minded incredible technicians, take their commitment to animals, owners and the pet community seriously.

The right candidate will enjoy a one-of-a-kind working environment, as well as a great clientele and a fully equipped facility.

What you'll need to succeed:

  • Licensed (or eligibility) to practice veterinary medicine in Nova Scotia
  • Passion for what you do every day
  • Keen interest and/or experience in orthopaedic surgery
  • Enthusiasm, energy and a positive attitude are a must
  • A strong desire to educate and build solid relationships with clients
  • Excellent communication skills, both when dealing with clients and team members

If you are interested in this role and require further information, please:


APPLY NOW BELOW


If this role is not quite right for you but you are looking for a new permanent or temporary position, please see ALL JOBS.

You can also contact us via email on info@thevetservice.com or call +44 (0) 1218 177 864 to speak to your personal area advisor.

TheVetService.com is a global digital vet job platform providing all your career needs in the veterinary industry.

Our Services Include:

Clinical Jobs – Locum and Permanent Opportunities for vets and nurses in the UK, USA, New Zealand, Australia, Canada, Northern Ireland and the Republic Of Ireland.

Commercial Jobs – Industry and commercial roles from sales to technical advisory positions within many corporate and independent businesses active in the veterinary industry. From Pharmaceutical, wholesaler to financial positions your next step in your career is just a click away.

Education - Flexible, Cost Effective Digital Professional Development.

Register today for your free digital portal access and support from one of our expert team on contracts, visas, legislation and payment advice amongst other things.

All conversations are of course confidential.

title: Soon to be Registered Massage Therapists
description:
If you are interested in working for a client-focused organisation we would love to hear from you. Contact us today and we can sit down and discuss your future over a cup of coffee.

Massage Addict is Canada’s first and largest membership-based massage therapy provider with over 100 clinics and more than 1000 RMTs nationwide. Visit our website to learn more about us at www.massageaddict.ca.

Massage Addict is proud to partner with The Arthritis Society.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Massage Addict is committed to diversity, inclusion, and accessibility for persons with disability. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract

Salary: $30,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekends

Licence/Certification:

  • CMTO license (preferred)

Looking to start your Career as an RMT? Look no further...

Feeling nervous about the transition from classroom to clinic? Take a tour of our fully equipped clinic and picture yourself as a part of our welcoming Massage Addict team.

At Massage Addict London you will find yourself amidst a team of fellow RMTs, Chiropractors, Acupuncturists and Reflexologists—in a nurturing and professional environment that is dedicated to supporting you and your career.

What we Offer:

  • a great work-life balance with flexible schedules
  • No administrative work.
  • full time reception coverage,
  • supplies,
  • billing,
  • booking services.
  • predictable income
  • Extended Health Care Benefits
  • Allowance for professional development and training

What we're looking for:

100% focus on providing the very best treatment for your clients

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 20-30 per week

Salary: $48,000.00-$70,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Regular sanitation, Masks, COVID Screening

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • London, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
The House of Healing in Dawson Creek, BC is looking to hire a Registered Massage Therapist (Alberta or British Columbia Registered). You will be working alongside a fabulous group of women. An Acupuncturist, Massage Therapists, Laser Aesthetics, Natural Health and Yoga. As a team we work to provide our community with the best health and wellness under one building.

What we bring to the table:

Newly renovated, comfortable and modern clinic.

Fully furnished treatment rooms

Receptionist, laundry and software program.

Competitive pricing and percentage based rent

Flexible Schedule

Extensive, consistently growing client list

Full bookings the day you start!

What you bring to the table:

Successful completion of accredited program

In good standing with a provincial licensed Massage Therapy association

Friendly, driven and outgoing

Works well in a team environment

Willingness to help heal patients

New graduates welcome

Dawson Creek is Mile Zero on the Alaska Highway, the gateway to the North! It is home to many great hiking trails and historical sites and is a thriving tourist attraction. Close to larger centres such as Fort St. John and Grande Prairie and home to many great local businesses!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Licence/Certification:

  • Massage Therapist Certification (required)

title: IMS, ACUPUNCTURE, DRY NEEDLING TRAINED PHYSIOTHERAPIST
description:
IMS, ACUPUNCTURE, DRY NEEDLING TRAINED PHYSIOTHERAPIST

There is an opportunity for a manual therapist to join our team in Victoria, British Columbia. IMS, Acupuncture or Dry Needling training is required..

We would prefer to have someone who has completed their Part A's but we will consider candidates that are aggressively pursuing their orthopedic levels. We have FCAMPT Part B therapists on staff to mentor the right candidate as well as Physiotherapists working towards their FCAMPT status.

We offer a dynamic learning environment where high quality care and service are practiced. Our busy clinics in Victoria also offer complementary services such as Massage, Traditional Acupuncture and Clinical Pilates.

The position is full time but we will consider part time options for the right candidate. Local Physiotherapists that are ready for a change and want to move their practice will be given special consideration and financial bonus.

Please call us today to book an introduction and tour our facilities. You can email your resume to the attention of Penny Salmas or Jeff Fitzgibbon at clinic@shelbournephysio.ca

title: newRegistered Massage Therapist (RMT) in Guildford Surrey
description:
Fantastic Opportunity For New Grads & Experienced RMTs!

Who we are:
Owned and operated by an RMT, Panda Clinic is a long-running, well-established health and wellness clinic. We have 4 locations across the lower mainland: Metrotown, Guildford, White Rock, and New Westminster. Our main focus is helping those in our community get back to their optimum health by providing professional physical therapy — for over half a decade!

Who we are looking for:
Whether you are a new grad or have previous experience, we are looking for positive, enthusiastic, and knowledgeable therapists to join our team. Currently, our RMTs cannot keep up with demand. So you’re sure to have a busy schedule right from the beginning, so you can hit the ground running! But don't worry, we are with you every step of the way to help ensure a seamless transition to our team.

What we offer you:

  • An RMT-owned clinic with a team of RMTs, physiotherapists, and Acupuncturists to collaborate on the care of your patients.
  • Conveniently located across from Guilford Shopping Centre. Lots of local amenities are available!
  • Free parking is available, bus & transit stops are within a 10-minute walk.
  • Extended health benefits plan available (paramedical 100% covered).
  • Easy to use practise management software that lets you access and update your schedule anywhere with internet access.
  • Full-time reception, taking care of booking, billing, and COVID-19 screening. We handle your patient reminders and direct billing.
  • Laundry & Linen services are all taken care of.
  • A dedicated marketing team and extensive referral network to bring you new patients
  • Flexible scheduling with an overflow of patients
  • Opportunities for professional development and growth within the business.

This is a fantastic opportunity for new graduates to learn in a collaborative environment with many experienced practitioners, OR, for an experienced RMT to really shine in this interdisciplinary setting.

Student therapists are welcome to apply!

We are looking forward to welcoming you as a new member of our team!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 40 per week

Salary: From $90.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Masks required for staff & patients in the clinic
Appointments required
Staff & patients stay home if sick
Cleaning of rooms & clinic in between patients

Licence/Certification:

  • CMTBC (required)

title: Acupuncturist for busy downtown Halifax clinic
description:
MASSAGE ADDICT | SPRING GARDEN

Registered Acupuncturist

Massage Addict is a national company that began in Nova Scotia in 2008. Now, with 100 clinics across the country and over 1,200 practitioners including Registered Massage Therapist, Certified Reflexologists, Registered Acupuncturists, and Chiropractic Doctors, we provide over 60,000 treatments each month to help our clients manage pain, stress, anxiety, injury, muscle tension, and much more.

Our well-established Spring Garden clinic is looking for a Registered Acupuncturists to join our multidisciplinary team. The ideal candidate is professional, has exceptional customer service skills, and a passion for improving the health of Canadians.

Our clinic has 9 treatment rooms and is located in downtown Halifax in the busy urban centre of Spring Garden. We offer a membership program which allows clients to enhance their health through regular monthly treatments and, at the same time, allows us to have a consistent client base.

Walk into a thriving clientele and let us support you in all things business and client management related, so you can focus on what you do best – provide high quality treatments.

What we offer

· Positive, fun and professional work environment

· Immediate client base waiting for you and a steady flow of clients all year round

· Clinical approach to treatments

· Comprehensive and competitive compensation package

· Flexible schedules to meet work-life balance

· Treatment equipment and all cleaning supplies

· Full reception services with business and client support (billing, laundry, booking, marketing)

· Optional health-care benefits package

Responsibilities

· Perform high-quality manual acupuncture treatments with a complete focus on the client

· Maintain equipment and treatment room

· Recommend treatment plans to clients

· Document initial assessment findings and at regular intervals document reassessments and progress notes in the client’s medical records according to the Charting Policies and Procedures of the discipline and program

· Work collaboratively in a team environment embracing our shared success culture and championing clinic processes and procedures

Qualifications and Requirements

· Must be registered and a member in good standing with a recognized Acupuncture association and have liability insurance

If you are a Registered Acupuncturist, with a passion for improving the health of Canadians, looking to work in an upbeat professional, and well-established clinic then we would love to hear from you.

We thank all applicants but only those qualified will be contacted.

title: Acupuncturist
description:
Kerrisdale Chiropractic & Massage is looking for a part-time BC licensed Acupuncturist who shares our passion for healthcare. We are a dynamic, well-established multidisciplinary clinic with a friendly and warm vibe. Our friendly staff provide competent admin services including booking appointments, direct on-line billing to extended health providers and help with your laundry (onsite). We use JaneApp software for chart notes and online bookings. The treatment room has natural light and is fully equipped and with a new height adjustable electric table. There is a shared kitchen for your use. Room rent is reasonable, $100/day. Free patient parking is available. We look forward to hearing from you.

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 4-12 per week

Salary: $60.00-$120.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift

Patients and practitioners are required to wear a mask when not in a treatment room.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Our office is Hiring Multiple Therapists Positions!!

Enhanced Health & Wellness is looking to add a Registered Massage therapist, Registered Physiotherapist, Registered Naturopath, Registered Acupuncturist, Registered Osteopath and more.

Our office has recently expanded into a brand new location with the intent to grow as a multi-disciplinary clinic, we would like to provide a team of experienced and qualified members to help patients focus on recovery and worry less on going to multiple offices for treatment.

This is a contractor position

We offer:

  • Full reception and billing services
  • Jane online booking system
  • Flexible work schedules
  • Support for future growth and advancing your career
  • Competitive percentage-based income
  • Rehabilitation area to work with patients
  • An enjoyable work environment
  • Laundry Facilities
  • staff lunch room
  • High Traffic location

Candidate Highlights:

  • Must employ a collaborative approach to care. This means they should be open to referring to other practitioners in the clinic whether it be Chiropractic, Massage, Physiotherapy or Acupuncture (or any other services we may offer in the future) as they will be getting referrals from these in house practitioners as well.
  • Willing to actively work on building up their patient base
  • Responsible, punctual, and reliable
  • Must be registered with an association of Alberta
  • Personable and able to build rapport with patients

New Grads and Experienced practitioners are welcome

If you are looking to join a team and expand your career, we are the place for you. Please email your resume today.

Work remotely

  • No

title: Acupuncturist (Fresh Graduates)
description:
Full Job Description:

We are looking for a talented and dedicated acupuncturist with exceptional customer service skills and a strong desire to provide a positive customer experience. The ideal candidate for this position must exhibit goodwill and ensure that all patients have a 5-star personalized experience. We work in an environment where you can perform your best, work-life balance is valued, and everyone is treated as a member of the family. If you’re positive, highly motivated, friendly, and looking to help others recover and improve their quality of life, we welcome you to apply. Come join our team of talented, experienced, and caring professionals!

Mindbody Wellness Centre is dedicated to supporting a balanced, healthy lifestyle by bringing together a team of complementary healthcare professionals under one roof to provide an integrative approach to wellness. Working with our multidisciplinary team to resolve health issues from the inside out and to promote a healthy and active lifestyle, our practitioners are trained and experienced in a wide range of treatments, including manual therapy, complementary, and alternative medicine. Our team is passionate about bringing patients back to balance with happy minds and healthy bodies.

Qualifications and Desired Skills:

  • Must have a valid Acupuncturist License (required)
  • Has an experience as an Acupuncturist (preferred)
  • Customer Service experience (preferred)
  • Medical Office experience (preferred)
  • Strong computer skills (preferred)
  • Has a desire to learn additional skill sets
  • Efficiency and ability to pay attention to detail in treatment protocols
  • Ability to exhibit a positive attitude and work well with both patients and other staff members

Responsibilities:

  • Provide prompt service with each appointment and perform services within the appropriate allotted time
  • Report to work on time and according to the posted schedule
  • Provide 30-60 minute acupuncture session to clients by appointment
  • Guide clients through our service offerings and determine which would benefit them most
  • Take a detailed client history and note any health conditions
  • Evaluate clients to determine painful or stressed areas of the body
  • Suggest future services and regimes to clients
  • Listen to clients during appointments and adjust techniques as they desire

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Health Insurance
  • Annual Paid Vacation
  • Paid Time Off
  • Employee Discounts
  • Over-Time Pay

For interested applicants, you may apply through Indeed or contact us at 905-201-9355 and look for Shirley.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Wearing of masks are required at the clinic. Hand sanitizers are located throughout. COVID-19 screening for all appointments.

Licence/Certification:

  • Acupuncturist License (required)

title: Registered Acupuncturist
description:
• Job Summary

    Park Integrative Health, Registered Acupuncturist, Full-time or Part-time, Sherwood Park, AB

    Position: Registered Acupuncturist

    Location: Sherwood Park, AB

    Summary

    Reporting to the Director of Allied Health, the Registered Acupuncturist works collaboratively with a team of health care professionals at Park Integrative Health (PIH) to prevent or treat illness and/or disease by inserting sterile needles into specific acupuncture points. The Registered Acupuncturist may use alternative therapies to normalize energy flow within the body. PIH is a private health and wellness clinic that specializes in providing comprehensive, collaborative healthcare to individuals in the greater Strathcona County and Edmonton area.


    We’re an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating an inclusive environment. All applicants are considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

    Responsibilities
    • Perform acupuncture treatments to improve patient’s natural self-healing and prevent or treat illness
    • Perform complimentary modalities such as Gua sha, cupping, electro-acupuncture, Low Level Laser Therapy, Tuina massage, auricular therapy etc.
    • Collaborate with other health care practitioners at PIH to develop and implement short and long term patient care plans
    • Perform patient intake and assessment
    • Schedule patients in lieu of administrative assistant
    • Assist with other clinic activities as required
    • Actively participate in the Client Care Program and Internal Referral processes to continue to maintain the highest quality of client-centred care. This includes completing all referral letters as requested, including letters via Medical to Allied, Allied to Allied and Allied to Medical
    • Uphold your own personal values at all times
    • Uphold the mission, vision, and values of Park Integrative Health at all times, including “unwritten” values such as treating each and every member of the organization with kindness, compassion, empathy and respect
    • Uphold and follow all policies and procedures as outlined in the Park Integrative Health Team Member Handbook
    • Uphold and follow all policies and procedures as outlined in the Park Integrative Health Human Resources Manual
    • The successful candidate will be expected to work Saturday or Sunday, plus weekdays/evenings
    Qualifications
    • Diploma in Acupuncture and TCM
    • Active registration with the College and Association of Acupuncturists of Alberta
    • Previous experience considered an asset
    • Professional liability and malpractice insurance
    • Current CPR certification

    • Please note: only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview.
Show more

title: Registered Acupuncturist
description:
Hybrid Health & Fitness is looking for a licensed and experienced Acupuncturist to join our team!

The successful candidate is someone who is dedicated to building and growing a long-term practice with Hybrid. We operate in a team-based environment that supports each other's skills to ultimately benefit our client's long-term health needs.

What's provided:

  • An existing client base that you can contact to build your practice
  • Online scheduling and e-charting service available
  • Flexible hours
  • Therapy table and onsite laundry service
  • Storage and cabinets for personal supplies
  • Dedicated room for all shifts
  • A supportive and friendly work environment

Requirements:

  • Candidate must be in good standing and actively registered with the College of Traditional Chinese Medicine Practitioners and Acupuncturists of Ontario (CTCMPAO)
  • Must have active professional liability insurance
  • Provide high-quality treatments with complete focus on the patient
  • Professional, positive, passionate individual with a strong work ethic
  • Collaborate with other healthcare providers to achieve best possible patient care
  • Have no restrictions or conditions to work

Expected start date: 2022-02-01

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $42.00-$72.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site gym

Schedule:

  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
To keep our patients and team members safe, we've implemented a stringent COVID-19 Policy which can be found here: https://www.hybridhealthandfitness.com/clinic-covid-19-policy

Experience:

  • Acupuncture: 1 year (required)

Language:

  • English (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Acupuncture License (required)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Acupuncturist
description:
Priority Wellness is a beautiful clinic in the heart of downtown Fort Saskatchewan offering Registered Massage Therapy, Manual Osteopathic Therapy, Acupuncture, and Naturopathy.
Our mission is to assess every patient’s entire health profile and establish the root cause of dysfunction. By creating thorough treatment plans we can offer a high standard of quality, holistic therapies.

We are looking for passionate and driven Registered Acupuncturists to join our team.

Therapists must have a therapeutic focus with a strong knowledge of Assessment, Treatment Planning, and home care. We offer competitive rates, an inclusive environment, and a brand new clinic space.

We Offer:

- Competitive % Splits

- All supplies (lotion, linens, etc.)

- Flexible Hours

- Clinic Aid Support

- Ergonomic Work Environment (hydraulic tables and stools)

- Warm and Welcoming Atmosphere (Zero tolerance for unprofessionalism)

- Brand new staff room and clinic renovations

- Opportunities for advancement and training

Looking for therapists who:

- Have thorough Acupuncture experience

- Have a passion for rehabilitation

- May have a passion for energy healing

- Are a member in good standing with their accredited association

- Enjoy collaborating with other healthcare team members

- Are professional in their dealings with fellow therapists/ staff

- Are committed to treating our clients with the highest level of care

- Are experienced in customer service

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Wellness program

  • Weekend availability

  • Acupuncturists: 1 year (preferred)

title: Registered Acupuncturist R. Ac
description:
Acupuncture Center Toronto is Hiring

Due to an endemic boom in high patient volume we’re seeking 2-3 R. Ac associates. Work at Canada’s largest and most prestigious clinic exclusively devoted to the practice of Chinese Medicine.

Note to recent Acupuncture graduates

The position is open to recent graduates who have successfully written their exams and are waiting for their CTCMPAO College designation. We'd be happy to get the ball rolling by training/mentoring you. No wasted time!

Why work with us?

  • Highest volume clinic in Toronto with a constant stream of new patients.
  • New, huge and gorgeous custom-built clinic. By Acupuncturists for Acupuncturists.
  • Best location in the city. Yorkville heritage building. Steps from Bloor/Yonge.
  • Not in an office building, windows, skylights, Ministry guidelines compliant and safety ensured.
  • Work and learn from some of the best in the industry. Guide us to help you learn what you need. Whether it’s Japanese Moxibustion, patient business communication or fire cupping, you’ll have access to our in-house mentorship program with senior Acupuncturists and R. TCMP’s in our Center.
  • Why wait years to have a full patient load? Grow your practice quickly with us.
  • You will be promoted and marketed like crazy- professional video bio’s, social media spotlights and blog features.
  • One of Toronto’s top three acupuncture clinics on Open Care
  • One of the “3 Best Rated” Toronto acupuncture clinics
  • Featured in several major media including National Post, Global News and Diply
  • In top 3 acupuncture clinics on Yelp
  • Positive reviews everywhere online
  • Heritage TCM clinic- 20 years in operation with large and loyal patient base
  • 1 patient-at-a-time clinic. No multiple patients/rooms at one time.
  • Positive, cool and drama free workplace.

What we can do for your career?

  • Make great $ doing what you love without waiting years to build a practice
  • Provide you with patient volume very quickly. You will be taking on LOTS of new patients and develop a following of clients that adore you.
  • Marketing, social media and advertising is 90% done for you by an owner with a business and PR degree.
  • Opportunity for mentorship and team collaboration
  • Support your skill growth with regular in house continuing education sessions.

What we are looking for:

  • Confident R.Ac with EQUALLY as strong people skills. Personality is huge for us. We are looking for the right fit with patients and our team.
  • Applicants who can work a minimum of 4 shifts/week. Shifts broken into pre-set blocks of either 9:00AM-3:15PM or 3:30PM-9:45PM. Must be available to work evenings and weekends.
  • You are stoked to join a clinic where there is more expected of you in return for more being provided for you. In short our clinic is EXTRA and that works just fine because you are too.
  • You are punctual, reliable, organized, patient focussed, humble and customer-service oriented.
  • Gentle non-aggressive treatment style.
  • You are a great communicator of Chinese Medicine concepts and can bring down concepts to a level that patients can understand.
  • You are cool with working in a “reception-less” clinic and managing your scheduling/communication with your patients.
  • You are naturally VERY quick at getting back to people and are prompt at returning texts, emails and are comfortable doing so 7 days/week to manage your shifts.
  • You have sound tech skills and comfortable using Janeapp/willing to learn.
  • You have a smart phone and are comfortable using your personal mobile for clinic purposes including Gmail and Janeapp.
  • You are open to working in a general practice with musculoskeletal issues being the bulk of your practice. You are also open and willing to treat EVERY health condition (which you will eventually in our clinic).
  • Someone who does not currently have or plan on starting their own practice at the same time downtown.

Compensation/Supplies

· Fair wage (split commission)

  • Beautifully loft Bloor/Yonge clinic. We take-up an entire floor; decked out with: art collection, stained glass, geodes, plants and flowers, exposed brick, natural light (skylights & tons of windows), heated hydrolic tables, air purifiers, wrap-around private outdoor patio, non-cluttered efficient workspace and a comfortable staff kitchen.

Please apply with resume and cover letter. Feel free to include any other online links (blog, website, LinkedIn, social networks).

http://www.acupuncturecentertoronto.com

Job Types: Part-time, Freelance

Salary: $1.00-$80,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations:
Distanced in common areas, masks required, hand sanitizing stations throughout facility, disinfection of work surfaces between patients.

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to work 4 (8 hour) shifts per week?

Licence/Certification:

  • PAN-Canadian, safety and Jurisprudence exams completed. (required)
Show more

title: Early Childhood Assistant
description:
EARLY CHILDHOOD ASSISTANT

Are you caring and courageous to spark a child’s creativity? If so, we are looking for you to join our team!

Kids & Company is Canada’s largest corporate childcare and still growing! At Kids and Company, our greatest priority is to ensure that we meet every child’s individual needs, providing a safe, secure and loving environment.

Although Kids and Company employees share a vision and common goals for our company, they come from all walks of life, speak dozens of languages and reflect the diverse families and communities we serve.

Job Description

  • Assists and implements enriched programs in accordance with curriculum objectives, developmentally appropriate practice and program philosophy
  • Assist children in activities
  • Read stories, tech songs, demonstrate the use of simple musical instruments
  • Prepare craft materials for the children, demonstrate their use and provide opportunities for creative expression

Requirements

  • C.P.R. and First Aid updated yearly
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Confidence to work under pressure
  • Childcare experience is required

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:

  • Dental – frequent cleanings, x-rays, minor surgical procedures and post-surgical care
  • Vision – eye exams

title: Acupuncturist
description:
You will have the opportunity to collaborate with a team of like-minded manual therapists, where our clients visit us for the experience, the educational knowledge, and impeccable level of care.

As an Acupuncturist at Kinetic Living, you have a deep-seated passion rooted in your community, to provide one-on-one care to your clients. You will assist them with not only with pain or injury, but provide them with the knowledge and skills to perform better.

What You'll Do

  • Provide a clinical approach to care and provide the Kinetic Living customer experience
  • Effectively interpret the patient's medical history, symptoms and overall treatment goals
  • Provide one-on-one care with a personalized treatment plan for your patient
  • Provide patients with appropriate rehabilitative exercises that go beyond the treatment room
  • Build a strong sense of community and rapport with your patients
  • Stay up to date with the latest evidence-based research
  • Participate in one-on-one mentoring with the other manual therapists
  • Participate in Kinetic Living community driven initiatives

Who You Are

  • Registered with the College and Association of Acupuncturists of Alberta
  • Maintain appropriate Liability Insurance
  • Flexible to work day, evening and/or weekend hours as needed
  • Attention to detail and the highest level of communication and customer service skills

Who We Are

  • Kinetic Living is a new and exciting multi-disciplinary health facility with a focus on providing excellent manual therapy and care, assisting our patients with their personal and professional goals.
  • Located near Edmonton's River Valley, in the Garneau, our health care facility is driven by results and tied the belief that it truly takes a village to assist our clients to achieve their level of greatness - whatever that may be.

How to Apply

  • Please provide your resume and cover letter.
  • We encourage you to apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

www.kineticliving.ca

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $40,000.00-$110,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

All guests are encouraged to wear masks, staff and practitioners are required to wear masks, hand-sanitizer stations throughout, all surfaces wiped between guests

Experience:

  • Acupuncturists: 1 year (preferred)

title: Acupuncturist
description:
Job Description

Kefi Wellness Centre, located in Oakville, Ontario, is looking for registered acupuncturists to join our rapidly growing team. The ideal candidate must be able to apply acupuncture knowledge to treat various conditions through a proficient understanding of Traditional Chinese Medicine in order to promote, maintain, and/or restore the holistic health of patients. Both part-time and full-time Registered Acupuncturists are welcome to join our collaborative health team with a rapidly growing patient base.

About Us

Kefi wellness centre is a newly established multidisciplinary clinic located in Oakville, Ontario. We aim to provide evidence-based treatment to our patients with patient-centred care. We want to partner with our patients that take a proactive and preventative approach to maintain a higher quality of life.

Job Duties

  • Assess physical findings and patients’ medical records or history and make a diagnosis
  • Identify goals with patients and develop a treatment plan
  • Treating patients with needles and any other tool or technique deemed beneficial
  • Keep detailed notes and records of patients’ progress
  • Maintain a safe and healthy environment
  • Comply with all regulations

Requirements

  • Registered with CTCMPAO with a good standing
  • Valid liability insurance
  • Excellent communication and client management skills
  • Knowledge of Tuina is a good asset
  • Work independently when proposing and applying customized treatment plans
  • Willing to work collaboratively with other healthcare providers to discuss cases
  • Reliable, professional, and looking for growth

Bonus Perks

  • New graduates are welcome to apply
  • Negotiable competitive percent split
  • Flexible schedules and hours
  • All necessary supplies (sheets, needles, clinical supplies)
  • Onsite gym for rehabilitation
  • Cutting-edge modalities
  • Jane app booking system
  • Direct Billing to insurance companies
  • Staff rated therapies
  • In house laundry
  • Onsite free parking
  • Medical centre with family doctors next door
  • Professional marketing with social media, and advertising

Working Conditions

  • Close physical contact with patients
  • Prolonged periods of standing
  • Repetitive motions

Kefi Wellness Centre is an equal opportunity employer, and we thank everyone for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted. In keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodations are available throughout the recruitment and selection process and will be provided upon request.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $55.00-$65.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Liability insurance (required)
  • Registered with CTCMPAO with a good standing (required)

Expected start date: 2022-05-30

title: Acupuncturist
description:
We are a multidisciplinary clinic looking to hire Acupuncturists to join our growing team! Our facility provides chiropractic services, fascial stretch therapy, physiotherapy, massage therapy, athletic therapy, osteopathy, traditional Chinese medicine, and more. First established in 2017, we have now grown to serve three locations across Toronto. Our locations feature multi-room settings with laundry, as well as brand new gym facilities and equipment for active rehabilitation.

Our philosophy prioritizes Fascial Stretch Therapy, along with traditional modalities, to help treat a wide range of acute and chronic injuries, as well as aid our clients in achieving their health-related goals. Our clientele is varied, ranging from the athletic to general population to those with disabilities or special needs.

Our therapists work together for inter-office referrals, in addition to receiving new patients from outside sources.

What we are looking for:

- Strong work ethic, able to work independently and maintain your clientele
- Friendly, energetic, and personable; willingness to learn new skills and techniques and work in a team environment
- Desire to grow with our team
- Additional certifications not required but considered an asset

title: Acupuncturist
description:
Acupuncturist

Lifemark Physiotherapy, located in Sherwood Parks Professional/Medical building - Synergy Wellness Centre, is looking for a full-time acupuncturist (weekdays: 7:30 am – 1:30 pm/ with Saturdays optional). This position is being posted in response to a high request of patients with extended health care that includes benefits/coverage for acupuncture. The candidate chosen for the position will be the primary and only acupuncturist for this location. A successful candidate would be capable and willing to work in collaboration with a multi-disciplinary team of physicians, physiotherapists, kinesiologists, occupational therapists, chiropractors, and massage therapists, with a medical/clinical approach to treating conditions such as, but not limited to, pain management, anxiety, muscle tension, TMJ dysfunction, emotional trauma, relaxation.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Assess and diagnose patients using special techniques within a medical and holistic framework
  • Provide treatment within the Acupuncture scope of practice
  • Consider a patient’s vitality and general physical, mental, and emotional condition
  • Work independently and collaboratively within an interdisciplinary team
  • Maintain accurate and detailed electronic treatment notes

The Successful Candidate is:

Social: Interest in co-ordinating information about patients’ general physical conditions obtained through physicals and medical tests, and by observing and interviewing.

Innovative: Interest in precision working to insert acupuncture needles at precise points to treat disorders, relieve pain, and improve and maintain health.

Methodical: Interest in mentoring patients by diagnosing and treating disorders and injuries using the established techniques and methods of acupuncture.

Skills & Abilities:

  • An ethical, responsible, and caring attitude
  • The ability to listen, speak, and document well
  • A mature and professional approach
  • The ability to gain patients trust and confidence
  • Should enjoy observing and speaking to people, performing precision tasks, and providing advice
  • Provide a collaborative approach to care
  • Work within the clinical framework (for example, working in a scent free environment)

Qualifications:

Registered and in good standing as an Acupuncturist with a regulatory organization in Alberta, Canada.

Graduate of an approved program of studies (example: MacEwan University)

Have at least 500 hours of practice in the previous 2 years.

Mandatory requirement: All Lifemark Health Group employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Full vaccination occurs 14 days following the second dose of a Health Canada approved vaccine.

Show more
