title: Acupuncturist for busy downtown Halifax clinic
description:
MASSAGE ADDICT | SPRING GARDEN

Registered Acupuncturist

Massage Addict is a national company that began in Nova Scotia in 2008. Now, with 100 clinics across the country and over 1,200 practitioners including Registered Massage Therapist, Certified Reflexologists, Registered Acupuncturists, and Chiropractic Doctors, we provide over 60,000 treatments each month to help our clients manage pain, stress, anxiety, injury, muscle tension, and much more.

Our well-established Spring Garden clinic is looking for a Registered Acupuncturists to join our multidisciplinary team. The ideal candidate is professional, has exceptional customer service skills, and a passion for improving the health of Canadians.

Our clinic has 9 treatment rooms and is located in downtown Halifax in the busy urban centre of Spring Garden. We offer a membership program which allows clients to enhance their health through regular monthly treatments and, at the same time, allows us to have a consistent client base.

Walk into a thriving clientele and let us support you in all things business and client management related, so you can focus on what you do best – provide high quality treatments.

What we offer

· Positive, fun and professional work environment

· Immediate client base waiting for you and a steady flow of clients all year round

· Clinical approach to treatments

· Comprehensive and competitive compensation package

· Flexible schedules to meet work-life balance

· Treatment equipment and all cleaning supplies

· Full reception services with business and client support (billing, laundry, booking, marketing)

· Optional health-care benefits package

Responsibilities

· Perform high-quality manual acupuncture treatments with a complete focus on the client

· Maintain equipment and treatment room

· Recommend treatment plans to clients

· Document initial assessment findings and at regular intervals document reassessments and progress notes in the client’s medical records according to the Charting Policies and Procedures of the discipline and program

· Work collaboratively in a team environment embracing our shared success culture and championing clinic processes and procedures

Qualifications and Requirements

· Must be registered and a member in good standing with a recognized Acupuncture association and have liability insurance

If you are a Registered Acupuncturist, with a passion for improving the health of Canadians, looking to work in an upbeat professional, and well-established clinic then we would love to hear from you.

We thank all applicants but only those qualified will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Casual

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

description:
SOMMAIRE
Clinique : Valleyfield (408, rue Jeanne-Mance, local 900 Valleyfield, Québec, J6T 4G1)
Horaire : à déterminer
Statut : consultant

DESCRIPTION
  • Effectuer ses fonctions selon ses capacités professionnelles en collaboration avec les thérapeutes.
  • Travailler de concert avec le personnel d’une équipe multidisciplinaire afin d’optimiser les soins et services offerts aux patients.
  • Offrir un traitement adéquat au patient qui présente des problèmes de santé d’origines variées et ce, afin d’optimiser sa guérison.

EXIGENCES
  • Membre en règle de l’Ordre des acupuncteurs du Québec;
  • Intérêt à travailler dans un environnement multidisciplinaire;
  • Prêt à s'investir pour développer le service à la clinique;
  • Bilingue français/anglais (atout).

HORAIRE
  • À déterminer selon les disponibilités de l'acupuncteur et les besoins de la clinique
  • Le poste peut être à temps plein ; si le candidat souhaite travailler à la clinique de l'Île Perrot et de Vallyfield.

Veuillez prendre note que le masculin est utilisé afin d’alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

  • Carry out his functions in a professional way in accordance with his professional capabilities in collaboration with the therapists;
  • Work with the staff of our multidisciplinary team to optimize patient care and services;
  • Provide adequate treatment for patients with health problems from a variety of backgrounds in order to optimize their healing.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Be a member in good standing of the Ordre des acupuncteurs du Québec;
  • Interest in working in a multidisciplinary environment;
  • Ready to put the efforts in developing the service at the clinic;
  • Bilingual French/English (asset).

SCHEDULE
  • To be determined according to the availability of the acupuncturist and the needs of the clinic
  • Position can be full-time; if candidate would like to work at Ile Perrot and Vallyfield clinic

Please note that the masculine is used to simplify the text, without prejudice to the female form.

title: Acupuncturist
description:
Acupuncturist/Doctor of Traditional Chinese Medicine - CONTRACTOR

Looking for an Independent Contractor, this is NOT an employment position. We are an established multidisciplinary healthcare office in easily accessible SW downtown core of Calgary is seeking a Doctor of Traditional Chinese Medicine to join our tight-knit team of independent contractors. This includes naturopathic doctors, physiotherapist, Osteopathic Manual Therapist and others. Your patients will have access to FREE downtown parking! Hours are flexible between 9am-7pm and Monday through Sunday.

Responsibilities Include:

· Provide outstanding therapeutic services within your professional scope.

· Create techniques and strategies for wellness and prevention.

· Willingness to establish a proper practice flow with limited direction.

· Ability to work independently, self-motivated to build their own clientele.

· Excel in a team environment supporting existing clients at the clinic.

· Be professional in dealing with staff and clients in all situations.

· Support scheduling and processing during non-administration hours.

· Become an integral part of our integrative team, contributing ideas and feedback.

Ideal Candidate Possesses:

· Excellent etiquette, interpersonal and communication skills in English.

· Self-motivated, creatively resourceful, independent, fast-learning, fast-adapting, maximize work time and organized.

· Help create and maintain the best possible workplace environment so you can excel at helping to heal your patients in an ideal setting.

· Friendly, team based attitude

· Demonstrable passion, knowledge and/or interest in Naturopathic Medicine, Nutrition, Acupuncture, Massage Therapy, Energetic Medicine and other integrative healthcare professionals.

· Experience in sales and/or business.

· Flexibility in hours - days, evenings and/or weekends.

· Have an interest in co-managing patients with acupuncture

Want to be part of a team who works together to help others? We want to work with you!

Email your cover letter and résumé in a single PDF document. Indicate your preference for PT/FT/RENT, start date & weekly availability and expectations for compensation.

We thank all applicants, but only those selected for interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Freelance

Salary: $1.00-$99,999.00 per month

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

COVID-19 considerations:
We follow all current government regulations concerning COVID-19

Language:

  • English (required)

Licence/Certification:

  • Acupuncture/DoTCM Licence (required)

title: Acupuncturist (Fresh Graduates)
description:
Full Job Description:

We are looking for a talented and dedicated acupuncturist with exceptional customer service skills and a strong desire to provide a positive customer experience. The ideal candidate for this position must exhibit goodwill and ensure that all patients have a 5-star personalized experience. We work in an environment where you can perform your best, work-life balance is valued, and everyone is treated as a member of the family. If you’re positive, highly motivated, friendly, and looking to help others recover and improve their quality of life, we welcome you to apply. Come join our team of talented, experienced, and caring professionals!

Mindbody Wellness Centre is dedicated to supporting a balanced, healthy lifestyle by bringing together a team of complementary healthcare professionals under one roof to provide an integrative approach to wellness. Working with our multidisciplinary team to resolve health issues from the inside out and to promote a healthy and active lifestyle, our practitioners are trained and experienced in a wide range of treatments, including manual therapy, complementary, and alternative medicine. Our team is passionate about bringing patients back to balance with happy minds and healthy bodies.

Qualifications and Desired Skills:

  • Must have a valid Acupuncturist License (required)
  • Has an experience as an Acupuncturist (preferred)
  • Customer Service experience (preferred)
  • Medical Office experience (preferred)
  • Strong computer skills (preferred)
  • Has a desire to learn additional skill sets
  • Efficiency and ability to pay attention to detail in treatment protocols
  • Ability to exhibit a positive attitude and work well with both patients and other staff members

Responsibilities:

  • Provide prompt service with each appointment and perform services within the appropriate allotted time
  • Report to work on time and according to the posted schedule
  • Provide 30-60 minute acupuncture session to clients by appointment
  • Guide clients through our service offerings and determine which would benefit them most
  • Take a detailed client history and note any health conditions
  • Evaluate clients to determine painful or stressed areas of the body
  • Suggest future services and regimes to clients
  • Listen to clients during appointments and adjust techniques as they desire

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Health Insurance
  • Annual Paid Vacation
  • Paid Time Off
  • Employee Discounts
  • Over-Time Pay

For interested applicants, you may apply through Indeed or contact us at 905-201-9355 and look for Shirley.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Part-time hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
Wearing of masks are required at the clinic. Hand sanitizers are located throughout. COVID-19 screening for all appointments.

Licence/Certification:

  • Acupuncturist License (required)

description:
Acupuncture Center Toronto is Hiring

Due to an endemic boom in high patient volume we’re seeking 2-3 R. Ac associates. Work at Canada’s largest and most prestigious clinic exclusively devoted to the practice of Chinese Medicine.

Note to recent Acupuncture graduates

The position is open to recent graduates who have successfully written their exams and are waiting for their CTCMPAO College designation. We'd be happy to get the ball rolling by training/mentoring you. No wasted time!

Why work with us?

  • Highest volume clinic in Toronto with a constant stream of new patients.
  • New, huge and gorgeous custom-built clinic. By Acupuncturists for Acupuncturists.
  • Best location in the city. Yorkville heritage building. Steps from Bloor/Yonge.
  • Not in an office building, windows, skylights, Ministry guidelines compliant and safety ensured.
  • Work and learn from some of the best in the industry. Guide us to help you learn what you need. Whether it’s Japanese Moxibustion, patient business communication or fire cupping, you’ll have access to our in-house mentorship program with senior Acupuncturists and R. TCMP’s in our Center.
  • Why wait years to have a full patient load? Grow your practice quickly with us.
  • You will be promoted and marketed like crazy- professional video bio’s, social media spotlights and blog features.
  • One of Toronto’s top three acupuncture clinics on Open Care
  • One of the “3 Best Rated” Toronto acupuncture clinics
  • Featured in several major media including National Post, Global News and Diply
  • In top 3 acupuncture clinics on Yelp
  • Positive reviews everywhere online
  • Heritage TCM clinic- 20 years in operation with large and loyal patient base
  • 1 patient-at-a-time clinic. No multiple patients/rooms at one time.
  • Positive, cool and drama free workplace.

What we can do for your career?

  • Make great $ doing what you love without waiting years to build a practice
  • Provide you with patient volume very quickly. You will be taking on LOTS of new patients and develop a following of clients that adore you.
  • Marketing, social media and advertising is 90% done for you by an owner with a business and PR degree.
  • Opportunity for mentorship and team collaboration
  • Support your skill growth with regular in house continuing education sessions.

What we are looking for:

  • Confident R.Ac with EQUALLY as strong people skills. Personality is huge for us. We are looking for the right fit with patients and our team.
  • Applicants who can work a minimum of 4 shifts/week. Shifts broken into pre-set blocks of either 9:00AM-3:15PM or 3:30PM-9:45PM. Must be available to work evenings and weekends.
  • You are stoked to join a clinic where there is more expected of you in return for more being provided for you. In short our clinic is EXTRA and that works just fine because you are too.
  • You are punctual, reliable, organized, patient focussed, humble and customer-service oriented.
  • Gentle non-aggressive treatment style.
  • You are a great communicator of Chinese Medicine concepts and can bring down concepts to a level that patients can understand.
  • You are cool with working in a “reception-less” clinic and managing your scheduling/communication with your patients.
  • You are naturally VERY quick at getting back to people and are prompt at returning texts, emails and are comfortable doing so 7 days/week to manage your shifts.
  • You have sound tech skills and comfortable using Janeapp/willing to learn.
  • You have a smart phone and are comfortable using your personal mobile for clinic purposes including Gmail and Janeapp.
  • You are open to working in a general practice with musculoskeletal issues being the bulk of your practice. You are also open and willing to treat EVERY health condition (which you will eventually in our clinic).
  • Someone who does not currently have or plan on starting their own practice at the same time downtown.

Compensation/Supplies

· Fair wage (split commission)

  • Beautifully loft Bloor/Yonge clinic. We take-up an entire floor; decked out with: art collection, stained glass, geodes, plants and flowers, exposed brick, natural light (skylights & tons of windows), heated hydrolic tables, air purifiers, wrap-around private outdoor patio, non-cluttered efficient workspace and a comfortable staff kitchen.

Please apply with resume and cover letter. Feel free to include any other online links (blog, website, LinkedIn, social networks).

http://www.acupuncturecentertoronto.com

Job Types: Part-time, Freelance

Salary: $1.00-$80,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations:
Distanced in common areas, masks required, hand sanitizing stations throughout facility, disinfection of work surfaces between patients.

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to work 4 (8 hour) shifts per week?

Licence/Certification:

  • PAN-Canadian, safety and Jurisprudence exams completed. (required)

title: Registered Acupuncturist
description:
• Job Summary

    Park Integrative Health, Registered Acupuncturist, Full-time or Part-time, Sherwood Park, AB

    Position: Registered Acupuncturist

    Location: Sherwood Park, AB

    Summary

    Reporting to the Director of Allied Health, the Registered Acupuncturist works collaboratively with a team of health care professionals at Park Integrative Health (PIH) to prevent or treat illness and/or disease by inserting sterile needles into specific acupuncture points. The Registered Acupuncturist may use alternative therapies to normalize energy flow within the body. PIH is a private health and wellness clinic that specializes in providing comprehensive, collaborative healthcare to individuals in the greater Strathcona County and Edmonton area.


    We’re an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating an inclusive environment. All applicants are considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

    Responsibilities
    • Perform acupuncture treatments to improve patient’s natural self-healing and prevent or treat illness
    • Perform complimentary modalities such as Gua sha, cupping, electro-acupuncture, Low Level Laser Therapy, Tuina massage, auricular therapy etc.
    • Collaborate with other health care practitioners at PIH to develop and implement short and long term patient care plans
    • Perform patient intake and assessment
    • Schedule patients in lieu of administrative assistant
    • Assist with other clinic activities as required
    • Actively participate in the Client Care Program and Internal Referral processes to continue to maintain the highest quality of client-centred care. This includes completing all referral letters as requested, including letters via Medical to Allied, Allied to Allied and Allied to Medical
    • Uphold your own personal values at all times
    • Uphold the mission, vision, and values of Park Integrative Health at all times, including “unwritten” values such as treating each and every member of the organization with kindness, compassion, empathy and respect
    • Uphold and follow all policies and procedures as outlined in the Park Integrative Health Team Member Handbook
    • Uphold and follow all policies and procedures as outlined in the Park Integrative Health Human Resources Manual
    • The successful candidate will be expected to work Saturday or Sunday, plus weekdays/evenings
    Qualifications
    • Diploma in Acupuncture and TCM
    • Active registration with the College and Association of Acupuncturists of Alberta
    • Previous experience considered an asset
    • Professional liability and malpractice insurance
    • Current CPR certification

    • Please note: only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview.
Show more

The successful candidate is someone who is dedicated to building and growing a long-term practice with Hybrid. We operate in a team-based environment that supports each other's skills to ultimately benefit our client's long-term health needs.

title: Acupuncturist
description:
You will have the opportunity to collaborate with a team of like-minded manual therapists, where our clients visit us for the experience, the educational knowledge, and impeccable level of care.

As an Acupuncturist at Kinetic Living, you have a deep-seated passion rooted in your community, to provide one-on-one care to your clients. You will assist them with not only with pain or injury, but provide them with the knowledge and skills to perform better.

What You'll Do

  • Provide a clinical approach to care and provide the Kinetic Living customer experience
  • Effectively interpret the patient's medical history, symptoms and overall treatment goals
  • Provide one-on-one care with a personalized treatment plan for your patient
  • Provide patients with appropriate rehabilitative exercises that go beyond the treatment room
  • Build a strong sense of community and rapport with your patients
  • Stay up to date with the latest evidence-based research
  • Participate in one-on-one mentoring with the other manual therapists
  • Participate in Kinetic Living community driven initiatives

Who You Are

  • Registered with the College and Association of Acupuncturists of Alberta
  • Maintain appropriate Liability Insurance
  • Flexible to work day, evening and/or weekend hours as needed
  • Attention to detail and the highest level of communication and customer service skills

Who We Are

  • Kinetic Living is a new and exciting multi-disciplinary health facility with a focus on providing excellent manual therapy and care, assisting our patients with their personal and professional goals.
  • Located near Edmonton's River Valley, in the Garneau, our health care facility is driven by results and tied the belief that it truly takes a village to assist our clients to achieve their level of greatness - whatever that may be.

How to Apply

  • Please provide your resume and cover letter.
  • We encourage you to apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

www.kineticliving.ca

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $40,000.00-$110,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
All guests are encouraged to wear masks, staff and practitioners are required to wear masks, hand-sanitizer stations throughout, all surfaces wiped between guests

Experience:

  • Acupuncturists: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registration with College of Acupuncturists of Alberta (required)

Our mission is to assess every patient’s entire health profile and establish the root cause of dysfunction. By creating thorough treatment plans we can offer a high standard of quality, holistic therapies.

We are looking for passionate and driven Registered Acupuncturists to join our team.

title: Early Childhood Assistant
description:
EARLY CHILDHOOD ASSISTANT

Are you caring and courageous to spark a child’s creativity? If so, we are looking for you to join our team!

Kids & Company is Canada’s largest corporate childcare and still growing! At Kids and Company, our greatest priority is to ensure that we meet every child’s individual needs, providing a safe, secure and loving environment.

Although Kids and Company employees share a vision and common goals for our company, they come from all walks of life, speak dozens of languages and reflect the diverse families and communities we serve.

Job Description

  • Assists and implements enriched programs in accordance with curriculum objectives, developmentally appropriate practice and program philosophy
  • Assist children in activities
  • Read stories, tech songs, demonstrate the use of simple musical instruments
  • Prepare craft materials for the children, demonstrate their use and provide opportunities for creative expression

Requirements

  • C.P.R. and First Aid updated yearly
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Confidence to work under pressure
  • Childcare experience is required

Benefits

We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:

  • Dental – frequent cleanings, x-rays, minor surgical procedures and post-surgical care
  • Vision – eye exams
  • Chiropractor, Osteopath, Podiatrist/Chiropodist, Massage Therapist, Naturopath, Speech Therapist, Physiotherapist/Occupational Therapist, M.S.W. Social Worker, Psychologist, Acupuncturist
  • Prescriptions, hearing aids, orthopedics, travel insurance
  • Long Term Disability and Life Insurance
  • We have opportunities for educational support and tuition reimbursement
  • We currently have over 100 daycares across North America and are constantly growing!
  • Positive work environment with encouraging team members and opportunities for career advancement
  • Monthly health challenges to promote work/life balance with exciting prizes
  • Enjoy 35% off our child care services and receive 20 days of FREE back up child care per year!

Kids and Company is an equal opportunity employer.

Kids and Company is committed to providing accommodations to persons with disabilities so that they may pursue employment opportunities in a similar way to other applicants. If you require accommodation as a job applicant, please contact us the HR department.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Store discount
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: Acupuncturist
description:
We are a multidisciplinary clinic looking to hire Acupuncturists to join our growing team! Our facility provides chiropractic services, fascial stretch therapy, physiotherapy, massage therapy, athletic therapy, osteopathy, traditional Chinese medicine, and more. First established in 2017, we have now grown to serve three locations across Toronto. Our locations feature multi-room settings with laundry, as well as brand new gym facilities and equipment for active rehabilitation.

Our philosophy prioritizes Fascial Stretch Therapy, along with traditional modalities, to help treat a wide range of acute and chronic injuries, as well as aid our clients in achieving their health-related goals. Our clientele is varied, ranging from the athletic to general population to those with disabilities or special needs.

Our therapists work together for inter-office referrals, in addition to receiving new patients from outside sources.

What we are looking for:

- Strong work ethic, able to work independently and maintain your clientele
- Friendly, energetic, and personable; willingness to learn new skills and techniques and work in a team environment
- Desire to grow with our team
- Additional certifications not required but considered an asset

title: Acupuncturist
description:
Job Description

Kefi Wellness Centre, located in Oakville, Ontario, is looking for registered acupuncturists to join our rapidly growing team. The ideal candidate must be able to apply acupuncture knowledge to treat various conditions through a proficient understanding of Traditional Chinese Medicine in order to promote, maintain, and/or restore the holistic health of patients. Both part-time and full-time Registered Acupuncturists are welcome to join our collaborative health team with a rapidly growing patient base.

About Us

Kefi wellness centre is a newly established multidisciplinary clinic located in Oakville, Ontario. We aim to provide evidence-based treatment to our patients with patient-centred care. We want to partner with our patients that take a proactive and preventative approach to maintain a higher quality of life.

Job Duties

  • Assess physical findings and patients’ medical records or history and make a diagnosis
  • Identify goals with patients and develop a treatment plan
  • Treating patients with needles and any other tool or technique deemed beneficial
  • Keep detailed notes and records of patients’ progress
  • Maintain a safe and healthy environment
  • Comply with all regulations

Requirements

  • Registered with CTCMPAO with a good standing
  • Valid liability insurance
  • Excellent communication and client management skills
  • Knowledge of Tuina is a good asset
  • Work independently when proposing and applying customized treatment plans
  • Willing to work collaboratively with other healthcare providers to discuss cases
  • Reliable, professional, and looking for growth

Bonus Perks

Our busy, award winning, Port Coquitlam, Port Moody, Coquitlam, Pitt Meadows, Maple Ridge locations is in need Full or Part Time Acupruncturist to meet our ongoing client demand.

We currently operate three locations in the Tri-Cities area and two more in Ridge Meadows. title: Registered Acupuncturist - Sports/Orthopedic
description:
Join our team!

We are seeking a Registered Acupuncturist who is looking for growth! You will assess an active population to treat injuries, and to provide recovery and preventative care. This is a position that can easily grow into full time role.

We are looking for a acupuncturist who is willing to learn, loves seeing their patients achieve their goals, and has a high standard for results.

Do you want to learn to be an outstanding clinician and get real results? We are willing to help.

If this is you, continue reading this post.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement acupuncture treatments that focus on maximum return to functional recovery.
  • Evaluate effects of therapy treatment and communicate patients' progress
  • Record and document patient care services

Qualifications:

  • Experience with an active/sports related population
  • Registration in good standing with CTCMPAO
  • Dry Needling/Cupping an asset
  • Ability to build rapport with patients
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Lives an active lifestyle
  • Has experience working with an active population

Benefits:

  • Excellent percentage/split
  • Free access to gym and group classes
  • Clinical and practice mentoring.

New Grads welcome to apply

Job Type: Part-time
Part-time hours: 8-10 per week

Salary: $40.00-$70.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

Benefits:

  • On-site parking

For our in clinic sessions we are implementing the infection control standards as stated by each regulatory college and the ministry of health.

  • Acupuncture Certification (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-07
Expected start date: 2022-05-15

description:
Evergreen Rehab & Wellness - Langley is now HIRING!

Acupuncturist
(Full time / Part-Time)

__
**

About us:

Evergreen Rehab & Wellness is a well-established and fully equipped multi-disciplinary clinic with 3 prime locations: Burquitlam-Coquitlam, Guildford-Surrey, and Willoughby-Langley. The Langley clinic is a newly built clinic with 4500 sq ft of space with a state-of-art interior in a prime location. (located right off of 200 St. Highway, and 3 minutes walking distance from Carvolth Bus Exchange). Evergreen Rehab and Wellness Clinics offer a great opportunity for both new grads and seasoned RMTs looking to join a great team of healthcare professionals in a densely populated & rapidly growing neighborhood. The estimated opening of the Langley location is in Early May 2022.

Benefits and Perks:

  • Competitive split percentage
  • Flexible days/hours: We open Monday - Sunday
  • Extended health benefit availability (depend on the contract type)
  • Team support to help fill your caseload in a matter of weeks.
  • Direct billing to major Insurance companies and ICBC
  • Online booking/charting through Janeapp
  • Full-time receptionists
  • Room fully equipped with Electronic tables, Needles, linens, towels, lotion, oil
  • Laundry services
  • A positive atmosphere
  • Staff discount package for our wellness program
  • On-site free Staff/Visitor parking

Responsibility:

  • Responsible for the patient’s care in terms of traditional Chinese medicine.
  • Treat patients by insertion of acupuncture needles or through simulation techniques.
  • Collaborates with other health care professionals regarding the patient's condition, needs, and progress.
  • Designs a treatment plan considering information gathered from assessment, relevant best practice guidelines, and clinical expertise.
  • Monitor the patient’s progress and provide an evaluation of treatment.
  • Communicate with ICBC, insurance companies, other healthcare practitioners, and other members of the team.
  • Document and chart patient’s progress and provides medical information upon request.

Qualifications:

  • must be registered with the CTCMA (College of Traditional Chinese Medicine Practitioners & Acupuncturists of British Columbia) with good standing.
  • Must carry professional liability insurance.
  • Willing to share our values and engage in clinic culture.
  • The ability to speak other languages is an advantage (e.g. Korean, Mandarin, and Cantonese)

title: Acupuncturist Shipboard
description:
This is a International Shipboard Position on cruise ships

The Company

OneSpaWorld is a worldwide provider and innovator in the fields of beauty, wellness, rejuvenation and transformation across the globe on cruise ships and on land. The company is dedicated to maintaining the highest quality standards and service delivery and is continually evolving to include all aspects of health and beauty while focusing on new advances within the spa, salon, fitness and wellness industry. Services include traditional and alternative massage, body and skincare treatment options, Ayurvedic treatments, comprehensive hair and nail services, mindfulness programs, fitness, acupuncture, herbal medicine, pain management, and Medi-Spa.

OneSpaWorld is looking to hire acupuncturists to work in their spas on board cruise ships throughout the world. Share your knowledge of acupuncture with the global community! Meet new cultures and see the world while you gain experience in your profession. This is an incredible opportunity to earn income while traveling the world! The position is commission based with a min. guarantee. Room/board are provided as well as acupuncture supplies. Acupuncturists have their own room on board. Flights to and from the ship on your first contract are included.

Position Summary:

An Acupuncturist administers the highest quality Acupuncture and Chinese medicine treatments to our on-board guests. They must possess a thorough knowledge of Chinese Medicine modalities (acupuncture, herbs, nutrition, etc.), and be able to communicate those concepts to guests. In addition, they must also possess a general understanding of all body treatments. They must have excellent communication skills and be able to learn the product and service knowledge necessary to effectively provide wellness solutions to meet the needs of our guests.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • To be on time for work, prompt with each appointment and to perform services within the appropriate time allocated.
  • Provide consistent professional TCM (Traditional Chinese Medicine) services and treatments.
  • Effectively inform and educate our guests about specific wellness concerns.
  • Be flexible with scheduling, supporting the needs of the spa and guest.
  • To properly care for equipment and use proper amounts of product to assist with cost control.
  • Have complete knowledge and understanding of all services and products offered.
  • Uphold the standards of sanitation and sterilization as directed by law, the vessel and the spa’s policies and procedures.
  • Properly clean and restock room as required.
  • Handle guests’ questions and concerns professionally and courteously.
  • Possess the ability to work without direct supervision.
  • Maintain a positive attitude and contribute toward a quality work environment.
  • Regularly attend, participate in and support training and staff meetings for the spa.

Position requirements:
  • Must have acupuncture diploma or credential
  • Must be able to give an effective presentation as it relates to acupuncture and TCM.
  • Enjoy working with people and possess a friendly and outgoing personality.
  • Excellent communication and listening skills, as well as basic computer knowledge.
  • Must be a team player.

Education and Experience Requirements: United States acupuncturists must hold a current valid state license and/or be certified by the National Certification Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine (NCCAOM).

Acupuncturists educated outside the

United States must have graduated from a program that is educationally equivalent to that of the United States. Degree programs are reviewed on a case by case basis and should include approximately 2000 hours worth of classroom and clinical study in the field of acupuncture.

Regular attendance in conformance with the standards, which may be established from time to time, is essential to the successful performance of this position. Employees with irregular attendance will be subject to disciplinary action up to, and including, termination of employment.

BEHAVIORAL COMPENTENCIES
  • Customer focused – Make service excellence a primary focus of one's actions; effectively meets service excellence; develops and sustains positive and productive service excellence; and takes responsibility for service excellence and loyalty.
  • Builds trust – Interacts with others in a way that gives them confidence in one's intentions and those of the organization.
  • Influencing others and facilitating decisions – Uses appropriate interpersonal styles and communication methods to gain acceptance of products, service, or ideas from prospects and guests (customers).
  • Collaboration and partnering – Identifies opportunities and takes action to build relationships between individuals, teams, departments, units, or organizations to help achieve business goals.

Come join a team of health professionals who seek to provide the best patient care by offering the most relevant services for healing.
Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un(e) acupuncteur, pour notre succursale de Chomedey, Laval, à temps plein ou partiel.
Venez joindre une équipe de professionnels de la santé qui cherche à offrir les meilleurs soins aux patients en offrant les services les plus pertinents pour la guérison.

title: Acupuncturist Shipboard
description:
This is a International Shipboard Position on cruise ships

The Company

OneSpaWorld is a worldwide provider and innovator in the fields of beauty, wellness, rejuvenation and transformation across the globe on cruise ships and on land. The company is dedicated to maintaining the highest quality standards and service delivery and is continually evolving to include all aspects of health and beauty while focusing on new advances within the spa, salon, fitness and wellness industry. Services include traditional and alternative massage, body and skincare treatment options, Ayurvedic treatments, comprehensive hair and nail services, mindfulness programs, fitness, acupuncture, herbal medicine, pain management, and Medi-Spa.

OneSpaWorld is looking to hire acupuncturists to work in their spas on board cruise ships throughout the world. Share your knowledge of acupuncture with the global community! Meet new cultures and see the world while you gain experience in your profession. This is an incredible opportunity to earn income while traveling the world! The position is commission based with a min. guarantee. Room/board are provided as well as acupuncture supplies. Acupuncturists have their own room on board. Flights to and from the ship on your first contract are included.

Position Summary:

An Acupuncturist administers the highest quality Acupuncture and Chinese medicine treatments to our on-board guests. They must possess a thorough knowledge of Chinese Medicine modalities (acupuncture, herbs, nutrition, etc.), and be able to communicate those concepts to guests. In addition, they must also possess a general understanding of all body treatments. They must have excellent communication skills and be able to learn the product and service knowledge necessary to effectively provide wellness solutions to meet the needs of our guests.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • To be on time for work, prompt with each appointment and to perform services within the appropriate time allocated.
  • Provide consistent professional TCM (Traditional Chinese Medicine) services and treatments.
  • Effectively inform and educate our guests about specific wellness concerns.
  • Be flexible with scheduling, supporting the needs of the spa and guest.
  • To properly care for equipment and use proper amounts of product to assist with cost control.
  • Have complete knowledge and understanding of all services and products offered.
  • Uphold the standards of sanitation and sterilization as directed by law, the vessel and the spa’s policies and procedures.
  • Properly clean and restock room as required.
  • Handle guests’ questions and concerns professionally and courteously.
  • Possess the ability to work without direct supervision.
  • Maintain a positive attitude and contribute toward a quality work environment.
  • Regularly attend, participate in and support training and staff meetings for the spa.

Position requirements:
  • Must have acupuncture diploma or credential
  • Must be able to give an effective presentation as it relates to acupuncture and TCM.
  • Enjoy working with people and possess a friendly and outgoing personality.
  • Excellent communication and listening skills, as well as basic computer knowledge.
  • Must be a team player.

Education and Experience Requirements: United States acupuncturists must hold a current valid state license and/or be certified by the National Certification Commission for Acupuncture and Oriental Medicine (NCCAOM).

Acupuncturists educated outside the

United States must have graduated from a program that is educationally equivalent to that of the United States. Degree programs are reviewed on a case by case basis and should include approximately 2000 hours worth of classroom and clinical study in the field of acupuncture.

Regular attendance in conformance with the standards, which may be established from time to time, is essential to the successful performance of this position. Employees with irregular attendance will be subject to disciplinary action up to, and including, termination of employment.

BEHAVIORAL COMPENTENCIES
  • Customer focused – Make service excellence a primary focus of one's actions; effectively meets service excellence; develops and sustains positive and productive service excellence; and takes responsibility for service excellence and loyalty.
  • Builds trust – Interacts with others in a way that gives them confidence in one's intentions and those of the organization.
  • Influencing others and facilitating decisions – Uses appropriate interpersonal styles and communication methods to gain acceptance of products, service, or ideas from prospects and guests (customers).
  • Collaboration and partnering – Identifies opportunities and takes action to build relationships between individuals, teams, departments, units, or organizations to help achieve business goals.

Powered by JazzHR

title: Acupuncteur / Acupuncturist
description:
SOMMAIRE

Clinique : Valleyfield (408, rue Jeanne-Mance, local 900 Valleyfield, Québec, J6T 4G1)

Horaire : à déterminer

Statut : consultant

Description
  • Effectuer ses fonctions selon ses capacités professionnelles en collaboration avec les thérapeutes.
  • Travailler de concert avec le personnel d’une équipe multidisciplinaire afin d’optimiser les soins et services offerts aux patients.
  • Offrir un traitement adéquat au patient qui présente des problèmes de santé d’origines variées et ce, afin d’optimiser sa guérison.
EXIGENCES
  • Membre en règle de l’Ordre des acupuncteurs du Québec;
  • Intérêt à travailler dans un environnement multidisciplinaire;
  • Prêt à sinvestir pour développer le service à la clinique;
  • Bilingue français/anglais (atout).
HORAIRE
  • À déterminer selon les disponibilités de lacupuncteur et les besoins de la clinique
  • Le poste peut être à temps plein ; si le candidat souhaite travailler à la clinique de lÎle Perrot et de Vallyfield.
Veuillez prendre note que le masculin est utilisé afin d’alléger le texte, et ce, sans préjudice pour la forme féminine.

===================================

Clinic : Valleyfield (408, rue Jeanne-Mance, local 900 Valleyfield, Québec, J6T 4G1)

Schedule : to be determined

Status : consultant

Description
  • Carry out his functions in a professional way in accordance with his professional capabilities in collaboration with the therapists;
  • Work with the staff of our multidisciplinary team to optimize patient care and services;
  • Provide adequate treatment for patients with health problems from a variety of backgrounds in order to optimize their healing.
Requirements
  • Be a member in good standing of the Ordre des acupuncteurs du Québec;
  • Interest in working in a multidisciplinary environment;
  • Ready to put the efforts in developing the service at the clinic;
  • Bilingual French/English (asset).
SCHEDULE
  • To be determined according to the availability of the acupuncturist and the needs of the clinic
  • Position can be full-time; if candidate would like to work at Ile Perrot and Vallyfield clinic
Please note that the masculine is used to simplify the text, without prejudice to the female form.
skills: ['Ready to put the efforts in developing the service at the clinic;', 'Provide adequate treatment for patients with health problems from a variety of backgrounds in order to optimize their healing.', 'Be a member in good standing of the Ordre des acupuncteurs du Québec;']

title: Licensed Acupuncturist
description:
We are a busy integrative clinic in the fast-expanding Brentwood (North Burnaby) and are looking to add another acupuncturist to our team.

Our modern clinic rooms are large, fully furnished with natural full-spectrum lighting. We have one designated ACU room and 2 multi-use treatment rooms which each have a beautiful hydraulic massage table.

The overall clinic atmosphere is calm and inviting with an amazing front desk staff that makes everyone feel welcome. Patient conveniences include easy access via Skytrain, free parking, and access to multiple practitioners (Chiro, Naturopathic, Acu & RMT) under one roof. Reception, online booking, and marketing via our website are all included.

We are looking for health care providers who are open-minded, motivated to build their own practice, and interested in working as part of a multidisciplinary team. New graduates are welcome to apply.

Our associate agreements are 12 month contracts, with a competitive percent split-based rent. Please send a brief resume and introduction to business@auroramed.ca and we will contact applicants for interviews. For more information about the clinic, visit www.auroraintegrative.com

title: Registered Massage Therapist and/or Acupuncturist
description:
Our clinic, Advanced Therapeutics Wellness, is busy! We have an opening for another RMT and/or Acupuncturist. We are an award-winning clinic established in 1989. Located in the Leslieville – Beaches community, we offer massage, chiropractic care, and acupuncture.

 

We are offering premium shifts Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays. Tuesdays and Wednesdays are also available.

 

You Get:

• Goodwill from our 30+ years serving the Leslieville and surrounding communities

• Access to new and existing clients

• Online booking and scheduling with ClinicSense software – manage your schedule from your phone

• Motorized Hi-Lo treatment tables and linens

• Front desk assistance part-time

• Calm and tranquil professional space

 

About You:

• You are licensed and insured with active professional liability, and in good standing with the CMTO

• You want the support to grow a thriving practice, with the opportunity to become independent and be a business within a business

• You enjoy working in a shared, co-op environment with other health care practitioners


Please send your resume and cover letter to kevinoatesrmt@gmail.com, and visit our website at www.advancedtherapeutics.ca.

title: Acupuncturist
description:
MASSAGE ADDICT | SPRING GARDEN


Registered Acupuncturist

Massage Addict is a national company that began in Nova Scotia in 2008. Now, with 100 clinics across the country and over 1,200 practitioners including Registered Massage Therapist, Certified Reflexologists, Registered Acupuncturists, and Chiropractic Doctors, we provide over 60,000 treatments each month to help our clients manage pain, stress, anxiety, injury, muscle tension, and much more.


Our well-established Spring Garden clinic is looking for a Registered Acupuncturists to join our multidisciplinary team. The ideal candidate is professional, has exceptional customer service skills, and a passion for improving the health of Canadians.


Our clinic has 9 treatment rooms and is located in downtown Halifax in the busy urban centre of Spring Garden. We offer a membership program which allows clients to enhance their health through regular monthly treatments and, at the same time, allows us to have a consistent client base.


Walk into a thriving clientele and let us support you in all things business and client management related, so you can focus on what you do best – provide high quality treatments.



What we offer

· Positive, fun and professional work environment

· Immediate client base waiting for you and a steady flow of clients all year round

· Clinical approach to treatments

· Comprehensive and competitive compensation package

· Flexible schedules to meet work-life balance

· Treatment equipment and all cleaning supplies

title: Massage Therapist
description:
• revibe: We are an integrated wellness team of physiotherapists, chiropractors, massage therapists, osteopaths, kinesiologists and naturopathic doctors on a mission to empower communities through wellness. 
  • Who you are:
  • Are you a therapist passionate about making a difference in people’s lives?
  • Do you want to create an impact in your community? 
  • And would you like to surround yourself around go-getters and leaders in the wellness industry?
  • If yes, we would love to meet you!
  • Below you will find 3 personas that describes the people we help everyday to become the best version of themselves:  
  • (1) You want to become an expert/specialist in your field, but you don’t know where to start. What you need is mentorship and opportunity to grow as a person.  
  • (2) Life feels repetitive and stagnant. You are tired of doing the same thing every day without feeling like you are progressing in your career. A leadership role in community, education, or business is what you look forward to.
  • (3) You are fed up with how the industry works and want to provide quality value and education alongside like-minded individuals who challenge the status quo. 
  • Prerequisites: 1-on-1 full body approach implementing manual therapy, corrective programming and accountability coaching. 
  • While we would prefer an individual with a few years of experience, we are open to considering a new grad who aligns with our vibe.
  • What we offer:
  • 1-on-1 quality time with each client 
  • No double booked rooms
  • No passive modalities 
  • No double booked treatment sessions
  • Option for social and private rooms
  • Full reception and billing services
  • Caseload Building
  • Technical Skills and Personal Development Workshops
  • Weekly and Monthly Clinical Mentorship Opportunities
  • Continuing Educational Allowance (up to $2000)
  • Performance Bonuses 
  • Personal Branding for referrals
  • Incentive plan ($)
  • Company sponsored team outings and dinners
  • Team sports (co-ed basketball, softball, soccer, run clubs, yoga etc.)
  • Community Partner Discounts 
  • Career growth opportunities (see below)
  • Access to recovery lounge, nutrition bar, private gym. 


  • How you can grow:
  • Therapy Lead: Focus on your personal growth and become the expert therapist for your niche of choice. 
  • Therapy Director: Diversify your clinical skills and get involved in the business side of things.
  • Wellness Director: Lead, grow and empower your team and community to become the best version of themselves
  • revibe Partner: Work together to drive change and create impact in the world (local, regional or global locations)


  • Who we are:
  • We are a social wellness house. Our vision is to empower communities through wellness to optimize vitality & longevity through our personalized, evidence-based approach. 
  • Our philosophy: To create an environment for an integrated, yet personal journey that challenges the pandemic of unwellness. An social experience that is unique to each individuals’ wellness lifestyle and goals so that they can do what they love to do better, forever. 
  • Core values:
  • Work hard, play hard 
  • Hustle hard, hustle smarter 
  • Be you 
  • Pay it forward 
  • Stronger together
  • Good vibes only
  • Fail fast, learn faster


Learn more at www.revibeto.com

title: Physiotherapist
description:
AWARDED OTTAWA'S FAVOURITE PHYSIOTHERAPY CLINIC 2020-2022 BY FACES MAGAZINE

AWARDED OTTAWA'S BEST WELLNESS CLINIC 2022

NOMINATED FOR TOP CHOICE AWARD 2021

______________________________________________

THIS POSITION IS FOR OUR NEW 5500 SQ FT. CLINIC LOCATION OPENING IN BELL'S CORNER/KANATA IN JULY 2022!


We are looking for a full-time Registered Physiotherapist to join our patient rehabilitation team and provide therapy and rehabilitations services to patients in our new location, which will be deemed a "super-clinic" due to its size and services provided. The ideal candidate is a compassionate healer who is passionate about their patients and committed to helping them recover their independence and mobility. We’re looking for someone with experience working with a wide range of patient injuries and age groups, who is always ready to learn new techniques to further patient care.

The person hired for the Physiotherapist position would treat new and ongoing patients in our facility to create a Plan of Treatment consisting hands-on treatment, exercise prescription, procedures and techniques required to promote effective, safe recovery. The right candidate is a patient, compassionate professional who encourages and inspires their patients to work toward greater independence and recovery, along with a punctual and effective therapist.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform initial assessments and chart according to the college's standards
  • Intake, assess, create treatment plans, and treat Motor Vehicle Accident clients/Veterans Affairs Canada clients
  • Develop Plan of Treatment for each patient based on initial and ongoing
  • Evaluations including short and long term goals and collaboration of treatment with other therapists in the clinic
  • Document patient progress according to charting procedures
  • Evaluate mobility, strength, pain, and current level of patient function, while setting goals to improve in these areas that are scaled to patient abilities and realistically attainable.
  • Report patient progress to patient, patient's insurance adjuster through MVA forms (if MVA patient), case managers (if MVA Patient), and healthcare professionals involved in ongoing treatment/care of patients.
  • Develop a plan for patients following completion of their Plan of Treatment with appropriate in-home care exercises
  • Maintain professional and technical knowledge and continue self-education 


Qualifications:

  • Experience with a wide range of patient age groups and injuries.
  • Looking for physiotherapists with extended health courses and specialities as well
  • A strong sense of empathy, a compassionate outlook on PT and the ability to motivate patients into pushing their limits in a responsible, safe way.
  • Must be registered with College of Physiotherapists of Ontario
  • Must hold valid Liability Insurance
  • Must reside in Ottawa, Ontario


Benefits of working at EWC:

  • Relaxed environment
  • Flexible schedule
  • 5500 square feet with all new equipment and any equipment you need is provided to you
  • Full gym area to work with patients
  • Private physiotherapy treatment rooms 
  • FSCO Licensed for MVA patients
  • Direct Billing Available to 20+ different insurers
  • Extended health benefits provided after 3 months on staff
  • Amazing pay split
  • Online booking system that directly allows you to check your schedule and book appointments
  • Online charting EMR
  • Multiple Partnerships with sports teams, doctors, OT companies, and personal injury law firms
  • Receptionists is available so no billing needed on your part just treat and keep track of your charts!
  • Kitchen, a separate break room from the kitchen, 2 bathrooms, a utility/supply room, another utility closet. Coffee, utensils, and cups are all supplied!
  • Electric table, shockwave, paper, ultrasound, IFC, tens, etc... all already provided
  • 2 Theraguns percussion guns on site
  • Medx Laser Machine Available


We are a multi-disciplinary clinic that provides a range of treatments. We provide our clients a one-on-one experience with our therapists in beautifully designed private treatment rooms to provide comfort to both the client and the therapist. We believe in our therapists taking their time with their clients, therefore we do not believe in taking in more than one client as once. This creates a positive, low-stress work environment for the therapist while providing true quality care for our clients. We work as a team to help the recovery process of our clients, whether it is a private client or a motor vehicle accident patient. We work hand-in-hand between our RMTs, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Acupuncturist, Registered Dietitian, Yoga studio, and IV therapy lounge to make sure that our clients recovery is maximized and they get the treatment they deserve. We also employ cutting edge equipment, from theraguns, shockwave, and cold laser treatment machine. Our clinic also boasts multiple partnership with personal injury firms, occupational therapy companies, sports teams, and believes in contributing to our community by sponsoring multiple youth sports teams.


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent


Salary: $75.00-$112.50 per hour

title: Physiotherapist
description:
We are a very busy, multidisciplinary clinic in west Mississauga looking for a senior self motivated, professional, and collaborative Physiotherapist to join our team.

Our clinic has a 20+ year reputation for expert physiotherapy care, with an emphasis on manual therapy and evidence based care. We currently have two physiotherapists, massage therapists, an acupuncturist, and an osteopath, as well as support personnel and professional administrative staff at our clinic. We are looking forward to growing and expending once again after the pandemic slowdown.

Our patient base includes private patients with common musculoskeletal issues and sports injuries, WSIB patients and patients post motor vehicle accidents.
The clinic is well equipped with professional hydraulic treatment tables, IFC machines, Ultrasound, Lasers, and various hydrotherapy and exercise equipment. All equipment safety-certified and calibrated on regular basis.

What we offer:
• Flexible part-time or full-time position
• Competitive remuneration
• Free parking
• Covid-19 protocols in place with PPE provided for all staff members
• Welcoming environment with an emphasis on teamwork and providing an exceptional patient
experience
• Discounts for all self-care treatments and products at the clinic, as well as for the immediate family
and friends

Requirements:
• Registered with the College of Physiotherapists of Ontario in good standing
• Broad knowledge of Physiotherapy theory and practice within a client-centered model of care.
• AT LEAST 3-5 YEARS OF CANADIAN HAND-ON EXPERIENCE OR A COMPLETION OF AN
APPROPRIATE CANADIAN UNIVERSITY PROGRAM
• Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively as a member of an
interdisciplinary team.
• Working knowledge of the MVA treatment plans and HCAI
• Basic knowledge of WSIB POC programs and treatment protocols.
• Excellent oral and written English communication skills
• Demonstrated ability to establish workload priorities in collaboration with others in a complex
health care environment.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Chiropractor
company: Back To Health Chiropractic & Wellness Clinic
description: Back to Health Chiropractic and Wellness was established in the beautiful Halifax suburb of Lower Sackville Nova Scotia in 2003 and includes 2 chiropractors, 2 massage therapists, 2 psychologists, an osteopath, and an acupuncturist. We also have 3 CAs who are experienced, kind and competent. Due to very high demand/high patient volume we are seeking a 3rd chiropractor to join our team. This is an independent contractor position which means you will be free to set your own hours and your patients will be yours. You will be provided with two treatment rooms which you will have exclusive use of. These rooms are already furnished and include two Elite electric elevation tables. Your remuneration will be at least 60%. If an opportunity to join a very busy chiropractic clinic with a multidisciplinary team that compliments and refers to each other to achieve the best patient outcomes appeals to you than reach out to us! We'd love to get to know you better and see if we might be the right fit for you!

title: Massothérapeute
description:
Au coin des rues St-Denis et Beaubien se tient une institution phare dans l’art de la relaxation. Depuis 1982, le Spa Ovarium innove en matière de bien-être en proposant un concept exclusif de soins mariant santé et détente, en milieu urbain.


Statut d’emploi


Salarié — Temps partiel 


Être disponible pour travailler la fin de semaine.

Nombreuses possibilités de remplacements de jour et de soir durant la semaine.


Conditions de travail avantageuses


  • Une équipe extraordinaire d’une trentaine de massothérapeutes, dont plusieurs travaillent à l’Ovarium depuis plus de 12 ans!
  • Un environnement de travail exceptionnel et facile d’accès (Métro Beaubien).
  • Grille salariale compétitive revue à la hausse fin 2021, qui prend en compte les années d’expérience en massothérapie.
  • Nous encourageons la formation continue. Plus d’une vingtaine de techniques sont offertes par l’ensemble de nos massothérapeutes.
  • Le gel de massage et les assurances de responsabilité civile générale et de responsabilité professionnelle sont fournis par l’Ovarium.
  • Possibilité d’adhérer à une assurance collective.
  • Les séances de bain-flottant, de PSiO et de NeuroSpa sont gratuites durant les périodes calmes.
  • Rabais sur les massages et sur les produits vendus à l’accueil. 


Exigences 


  • Être détenteur d’une attestation d’au moins 400 heures en massage suédois ou californien provenant d’une école réputée.
  • Être membre d’une association reconnue au Québec.
  • Être disponible pour travailler de soir et la fin de semaine.
  • Ponctualité.
  • Attitude professionnelle, respectueuse et bienveillante.
  • Parler français et anglais.
  • Présentation soignée.
  • Avoir complété la formation en massage prénatal dans l’année suivant l’embauche.

title: Thérapeute Bilingue
description:
Nous recherchons un(e) thérapeute bilingue (francophone) pour travailler avec les clients ALAViDA afin de s'assurer qu'ils sont soutenus pendant leur traitement et que leur expérience est optimisée grâce à notre plateforme de traitement numérique. Ce poste peut être sujet à un contrat à temps partiel (salarié) ou peut être rémunéré à l’heure.


Si vous êtes un(e) thérapeute à la recherche de quelque chose de différent et que vous avez de l'expérience dans les services complets de traitement de la dépendance aux substances, nous aimerions vous rencontrer.


Ce rôle consiste à travailler à distance au Canada.


Les responsabilités de ce rôle comprennent, mais sans s'y limiter :

  • Fournir un traitement virtuel fondé sur des preuves pour les clients souffrant de troubles liés à l'utilisation de substances
  • Développer et affiner les protocoles de traitement pour les clients en utilisant les meilleures techniques de traitement, dans les formats individuels et de groupe
  • Développer et affiner l'expérience client globale en collaboration avec le directeur clinique
  • Fournir une TTCi efficace suivant un protocole via notre plate-forme numérique
  • Favoriser et développer de solides relations thérapeutiques avec les clients en fournissant un soutien personnalisé via une messagerie sécurisée
  • Personnaliser les plans de traitement des clients grâce à la capacité à conceptualiser les besoins des clients
  • Encourager l'engagement des clients et le renforcement des compétences en soutenant leurs progrès tout au long du programme
  • Créer des rapports et des notes pour capturer clairement et avec précision les progrès du traitement de chaque client
  • Mesurer les résultats des clients et la satisfaction globale
  • Contribuer à un environnement de travail coopératif et axé sur le travail en équipe


Dans les 30 premiers jours vous serez tenu(e) de :

  • Apprendre la structure et le fonctionnement de l'entreprise et des programmes ALAViDA
  • Maîtriser l'utilisation de nos outils et systèmes
  • Se familiariser avec l'équipe et établir une routine et un calendrier de disponibilité


Conditions requises :

  • Titulaire d’un diplôme d'études supérieures en psychothérapie, ou santé mentale et relations humaines
  • Inscription auprès d'un organisme professionnel clinique (p. ex., CCC, RCC)
  • Bilingue (français/anglais)
  • Capacité de pratiquer à distance dans toutes les juridictions
  • Expérience de l'utilisation de la TCC pour traiter divers problèmes de santé mentale chez les adultes
  • Expérience de travail antérieure avec une plate-forme numérique pour fournir de la TTCi
  • Connaissance des stratégies fondées sur des données probantes pour le traitement des troubles liés à une substance et troubles addictifs, y compris la TCC, l'entretien motivationnel et la TCD
  • Solides compétences en communication écrite avec la capacité de rédiger des messages clairs, concis et professionnels pour soutenir nos clients
  • À l'aise avec le fait de travailler de manière indépendante mais capable de demander des conseils et de traiter les commentaires de rétroaction, si nécessaire
  • Maîtrise des compétences informatiques, avec une capacité démontrée à apprendre à travailler avec de nouvelles plates-formes
  • Accès à un ordinateur avec une protection par mot de passe et à Internet
  • Excellente communication et travail d'équipe
  • Capacité à gérer des informations sensibles et confidentielles
  • Passion pour aider les autres
  • Excellentes compétences rédactionnelles en anglais et français
  • Connaissance de l'industrie de la santé numérique en particulier dans les services de traitement de la dépendance est un plus



Avantages

  • Rémunération compétitive en fonction de l'expérience
  • Horaires de travail flexibles
  • Environnement de travail génial
skills: ["Titulaire d’un diplôme d'études supérieures en psychothérapie, ou santé mentale et relations humaines", "Nous recherchons un(e) thérapeute bilingue (francophone) pour travailler avec les clients ALAViDA afin de s'assurer qu'ils sont soutenus pendant leur traitement et que leur expérience est optimisée grâce à notre plateforme de traitement numérique. Ce poste peut être sujet à un contrat à temps partiel (salarié) ou peut être rémunéré à l’heure."]

title: Physical Therapist
description:
*This is a Travelling Physiotherapist Position for any Physiotherapist based in Canada who is willing to travelling to Newfoundland. Canadian Health Labs will cover the cost of travel and accommodations. Compensation is generous. Positions range from 28 days to 12 months. This position is exclusively for Physiotherapists who have existing licenses in Canada.


Canadian Health Labs (CHL) is a mobile healthcare provider under contract to provide healthcare services for various public and private sector organisations throughout Canada. This is an opportunity to contribute to keeping Canadians safe and healthy while getting to explore new locations across our beautiful country.


Experienced Physical Therapists are needed for travel/deployment assignments throughout Canada, providing community health services ranging from Long Term Care and all hospital departments. Plans, organises and implements patient/resident care programs to prevent or alleviate movement dysfunction, maintain and improve patient/resident’s potential to function. Responsible for all clinical aspects of assigned caseload as they relate to Physiotherapy practice.


  • Performing clinical assessments and implementing treatment plans for clients
  • Providing ongoing evaluation of client progress
  • Administering and collecting outcome measurement information


Evening and Weekend availability required. We are looking for individuals who can travel/deploy for a minimum of 30-days (or longer).


Required Skills/Abilities:


  • Candidates must be currently living in, and legally eligible to work in Canada and must be willing to travel throughout the Canadian Provinces
  • Eligible for membership with Canadian Physiotherapy Association (CPA).
  • Adhered to the current policies and procedures outline by the LTC facility/hospital setting and Canadian Health Labs
  • Maintain a safe and supportive environment for clients, family and staff members.


Education and Qualifications:


  • A graduate of a recognized university Physiotherapy degree program
  • Certified with the College of Physiotherapists
  • Current BCLS required
  • IMS and/or Acupuncture certification is an asset
  • Recent CRC (Criminal Record Check) via CSI Screening
  • Proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required as per provincial Covid-19 Immunisation and Management Policy. (All hires must have received a full dose series of a COVID19 vaccine approved by health Canada, and have received the final dose of the COVID19 vaccine within 14 days prior to the start date.)


Other Skills and Abilities


  • Preferably experienced within a private clinic setting or hospital
  • Demonstrates exceptional communication skills with patients and team members
  • Positive mindset and energy
  • Team player and passionate about contributing to a collaborative work environment
  • Friendly and professional demeanour
  • Self-motivated, has strong work ethics and provides excellent patient care
  • Effective management of time and space


Compensation:

Is based on experience and qualifications. Generous base + incentive options.


Travel and accommodations paid for. 


This is a CONTRACT position

title: Massage Therapist
description:
At Rise, we provide patients with a welcoming and comfortable environment for treating all types of physical pains, aches and injuries.

Our professionals use evidence-based practice to provide personalized treatment plans in our private treating rooms. Offering services like chiropractic, physiotherapy, massage therapy, acupuncture, naturopathic medicine and so much more, Rise is committed to providing our patients the best results!

What we offer

-competitive split compensation 

- flexible schedule (days and hours)

-A collaborative multidisciplinary team that offer internal patient referral  

-Private treatment rooms

-Free onsite parking

-full-time receptionist to take care off all the admin work

-PPE and supplies provided 

What we require from you 

-Registration, in good standing, the regulatory body (college/association)

-active license and insurance

-Dedication to grow and learn as a practitioner, as well as provide exceptional treatment to help patients feel their best


If this is an opportunity that interests you, please do not hesitate to reach out

title: Clinical Counselor
description:
Downtown Dartmouth wellness clinic focusing on wellness of the body, mind and soul is looking to have a more direct approach to wellness of the mind. We are seeking a part time leading to full time clinical counselor, clinical therapist, social worker, or psychologist to join our wellness team comprised of massage therapists, acupuncturist and traditional Chinese medicine practitioner, osteopath, and chiropractor.

Our clinic is a calm, friendly and peaceful environment with an air of healing energy. The team of amazing therapists have a camaraderie that adds to the soothing energy of the space. We take a collaborative approach by utilizing each other’s expertise to maximize the well being of our clients.

Beautiful treatment rooms, fairly flexible hours, competitive wages, and marketing are amongst a few of what this clinic has to offer a therapist.

If you are interested in this incredible opportunity or would like further information, please contact owner@naturalpathwellness.ca.

To apply, please include cover letter and resume. Diversity and inclusion are important to us, so LGBTQ+ and BIPOC folk are highly encouraged to apply.

title: Chiropractor
description:
ROLE: Chiropractor

FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: Day/Evening/Weekend opportunities available, Full time or part-time hours.


At Massage Addict Spring Garden we are excited to expand our team and service offerings and are looking for a Chiropractor to join us in this endeavour! This is a great opportunity for a new or experienced Chiropractor to build a strong clientele from our clinic’s already existing client base. We take care of all the business, administrative and client management tasks so all you need to do is focus on what you do best, treat clients!


Benefits of working at Massage Addict Spring Garden

• The ability to grow your clientele list with our clinics steady stream of new and returning clients

• Can work for us and others or at your home clinic (no non-compete)

• An opportunity to build a flexible schedule that works for your lifestyle

• Work with, learn from, and receive treatment from a multidisciplinary team of Registered Massage Therapist, Registered Acupuncturist, and Certified Reflexologists


What we offer

• Full administrative support – our stellar Guest Service team are motivated to help you build your clientele. They take care of bookings, filing, reminder calls, insurance processing & reconciliation, laundry, cleaning and of course, offering superior guest service to our clinic’s clients!

• Marketing – our clinic will take care of all marketing campaigns and social media marketing, pay for all marketing collateral and promotional materials, and we build strategic relationships to bring new clients into the clinic so they can experience the benefits of our services and your client base can grow

• Equipment & Supplies – we supply all the necessary items for treatment, cleaning, and PPE so you can spend your time focused on your clients!


Interested?

Right now, we are looking for a motivated Chiropractor to join our team either part time or full time. We provide high standards of treatment and expect high standards from our team. As the successful candidate you are driven to succeed in your career, passionate about Chiropractic care, and work well in a team environment.

title: Chiropractor
company: Avita Health and Massage Therapy Center
description:
Avita Health is looking for a full-time Chiropractor to take over a 6 year practice at our busy clinic. Our Chiropractor will be moving out of Province in July.

Avita has a team of 20 RMTs, 9 Physiotherapists, 2 Chiropractors, and 1 Acupuncturist. We have 10 administrative support staff, who offer our Practitioners complete support. Avita offers a beautiful facility, and an upbeat professional culture.

We are looking for a multimodal practitioner who can co-manage patients. Our current Chiropractor offers myofascial release, IASTM, and exercise therapy, in addition to adjustments/mobilizations.

Email us at info@avitahealth.ca or call Peter at 604-980-4491. Check us out www.avitahealth.ca.
