title: Conseiller au service / Service Advisor - Montreal, QC
description:
Conseiller au service

Ce poste s'effectue en télétravail.

Le rôle

Tesla Motors recherche un conseiller en service expérimenté pour travailler sur l'une des marques de véhicules les plus progressistes au monde. Ce poste exige une interaction de haut niveau avec les clients et les employés, de sorte que le candidat idéal devra non seulement posséder un sens aigu de la technique, mais aussi la capacité de fournir un niveau élevé de service à la clientèle. Si vous souhaitez faire partie d'une équipe de service de classe mondiale soutenant la dernière technologie des véhicules électriques, nous sommes intéressés à vous entendre.

Responsabilité
  • Répondre aux appels téléphoniques, aux courriels et aux visites en voiture afin de résoudre les problèmes des clients avec le plus haut niveau de réponse et d'attention.
  • Retourner les appels téléphoniques et les courriels manqués dans un délai d'au moins 5 minutes.
  • Déterminer si la solution technique peut être résolue par téléphone ; transmettre immédiatement le problème au chef d'atelier ou au directeur de service pour qu'il soit traité immédiatement.
  • Enregistrer avec précision les problèmes et les données dans le système de gestion du concessionnaire. Le souci du détail est essentiel.
  • Effectuer des transactions avec le système ; guider le client dans la correction et lui fournir un résumé
  • Communiquer le temps de réalisation estimé, les mises à jour régulières et le suivi de chaque véhicule du client.
  • Coordonner les détails de chaque véhicule avant la livraison.
  • Coordonner l'heure de livraison ou d'enlèvement avec chaque client.
  • Faire un suivi avec le client sur les services fournis ; s'assurer qu'il est satisfait du travail effectué.
Exigences
  • Connaissance des méthodes, techniques, pièces, outils et matériaux utilisés pour l'entretien et la réparation des véhicules.
  • Expérience de l'utilisation opérationnelle et de l'entretien d'une grande variété d'outils électriques manuels, d'outils d'atelier et d'équipement d'essai automobile et électrique.
  • Compréhension des techniques automobiles de base liées à la réparation et à l'entretien des automobiles.
  • Capacité à suivre des instructions orales et écrites en prêtant attention aux détails.
  • Volonté d'apprendre des technologies automobiles nouvelles et innovantes.
  • Capacité d'établir et de maintenir des relations de travail coopératives avec les personnes contactées dans le cadre du travail, y compris le public.
  • Tenue de registres et de rapports quotidiens détaillés.
  • Gérer efficacement des priorités multiples, organiser la charge de travail et respecter les délais.
  • Travailler en équipe et atteindre un objectif commun.
  • Système(s) de gestion du concessionnaire, Outlook et MS Office.
  • Expérience dans le domaine du service automobile au détail, de préférence
  • Doit posséder et maintenir un permis de conduire valide et un dossier de conduite acceptable et sécuritaire.
  • Doit avoir deux ans d'expérience de conduite
Rémunération et avantages sociaux
  • La rémunération est basée sur une variété de facteurs, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, l'expérience professionnelle, les compétences, les certifications, etc.
  • Avantages pour les employés à temps plein En tant qu'employé à temps plein de Tesla, vous bénéficierez de ce qui suit :
  • Des avantages complets dès le premier jour pour vous et vos personnes à charge éligibles.
  • Assurance maladie complémentaire (y compris ostéopathe, psychologue et acupuncteur)
  • Assurance vision et dentaire
  • Assurance vie, AD&D, invalidité de courte et de longue durée payée par l'entreprise
  • Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER) collectif
  • Programme d'aide aux employés, congés de maladie et vacances (horaire flexible pour les postes salariaux) et congés payés.
  • Services de garde d'enfants et rabais pour les employés
Service Advisor

This role is a work from home position.

The Role

Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced Service Advisor to work on one of the most progressive vehicle brands in the world. This position requires a high-level customer and employee interaction, so the ideal candidate will not only possess the technical acumen, but also the ability to provide a strong level of customer service. If you are interested in becoming a part of a world-class service team supporting the latest EV technology, we are interested in hearing from you.

Responsibilities
  • Answer Phone Calls, Emails and Drive In’s to address any customer concern with the highest level of response and attention
  • Return missed phone calls, email in no less than 5 minutes
  • Determine if technical solution can be resolved over the phone; escalate immediately to Shop Foreman / Service Manager to provide immediate attention
  • Accurately record issues and data into Dealer Management System. Attention to detail critical
  • Conduct Transactions w/ system; walk customer through correction and provide summary
  • Communicate estimated completion time, regular updates and follow through on each customer vehicle
  • Coordinate the detail of every vehicle prior to delivery
  • Coordinate the delivery time or pick up with each customer
  • Follow up with Customer on services provided; ensure they are satisfied with the work performed
Requirements
  • Knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and materials used in the maintenance and repair of vehicles
  • Experience in operational use and maintenance of a wide variety of hand power tools, shop tools, and automotive and electrical test equipment
  • Understanding of basic automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of automobiles
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail
  • Willingness to learn new and innovative automotive technologies
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work to include the public
  • Perform detailed daily record keeping and reporting
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goal
  • Dealer Management System(s), Outlook, and MS Office
  • Retail automotive service experience, preferred
  • Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and an acceptable and safe driving record
  • Must have two years of driving experience
Compensation And Benefits

Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to work experience, skills, certifications, etc.

Full-time Employee Benefits

As a full-time Tesla employee, you will receive:
  • Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents
  • Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
  • Vision & Dental Insurance
  • Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
  • Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
  • Employee Assistance Program,
  • Sick and Vacation time (Flex Time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and employee discounts

title: TECHNOLOGUE EN PHYSIOTHÉRAPIE - RNI SAPA NORD - RESSOURCE INTERMÉDIAIRE À JOLIETTE
description:
Description

Personne qui contribue à l’évaluation des déficiences et des incapacités de la fonction physique reliées aux systèmes neurologique, musculo-squelettique et cardiorespiratoire. Elle détermine un plan de traitement et réalise les interventions dans le but d'obtenir un rendement fonctionnel optimal lorsqu'elle dispose préalablement d'une évaluation faite par un physiothérapeute ou d'un diagnostic médical non limité aux symptômes qui indique, s'il y a lieu, le type de structure atteinte et qui est accompagné d'un dossier documentant l'atteinte. Elle peut participer à l'enseignement clinique.

Plus Particulièrement, Le TRP

Le technologue en réadaptation physique joue un rôle central dans l’optimisation de l’autonomie des résidents et veille à la sécurité de leur environnement physique.
  • Participe à l’admission de chacun des résidents en collaboration avec l’intervenant pivot (voir en annexe A : « Le rôle particulier de chaque intervenant lors d’une admission ou d’un transfert inter-RI»);
  • Assume le rôle d’intervenant pivot dans les situations présentant des besoins majoritairement reliés à une déficience physique (SEP, Parkinson, amputation, etc.);
  • S’assure de l’autonomie optimale des résidents tout au long de leur séjour en RI;
  • Assure la sécurité aux transferts, aux déplacements et de l’environnement de chacun des résidents, tout au long du séjour, ainsi que des lieux communs;
  • Effectue des suivis spécifiques selon les références médicales;
  • Évalue et complète les documents pertinents en vue de l’obtention d’une vignette de stationnement pour les personnes à mobilité réduite ou pour l’accès au transport adapté;
  • En collaboration avec le personnel de la ressource, tient à jour l’inventaire du matériel et de l’équipement lié à son champ d’expertise;
  • Participe à l’élaboration d’outils cliniques liés à son champ d’expertise de manière à ce qu’ils soient appropriés au type de suivi à réaliser dans les ressources;
  • Élabore et applique un plan de réadaptation en lien avec les difficultés du résident : équilibre, souplesse, renforcement musculaire, entraînement à la marche, entraînement aux escaliers, exercices respiratoires pour les personnes présentant une atteinte respiratoire chronique et contrôlée, tolérance à l’effort;
  • En collaboration avec l’intervenant pivot, s’assure de transmettre l’information pertinente en vue de la visite médicale;
  • En collaboration avec l’équipe interdisciplinaire, fait les interventions, le suivi ainsi que la transmission des informations relatives à l’état de santé du résident dans un contexte d’intervention intégrée en prévention des chutes;
  • Lorsque la situation clinique du résident l’exige, réfère vers le physiothérapeute ou l’ergothérapeute SAD;
  • Planifie, coordonne et anime les classes d’exercices au sein des ressources qu’il a sous sa responsabilité.
Exigences

Doit détenir un diplôme d’études collégiales (DEC) en techniques de physiothérapie d’une école reconnue par le ministère compétent.

Doit être membre de l’Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec.

Être adéquatement vacciné contre la COVID-19, à moins de contre-indication à cet effet.

Remarques

Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais nous communiquerons qu’avec celles retenues pour un processus de sélection.

Le CISSS de Lanaudière applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité en emploi et invite les Autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques, les femmes et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Les personnes handicapées peuvent également nous faire part de leurs besoins particuliers relativement au processus de sélection pour l'emploi sollicité afin de faciliter l'étude de leur candidature.

Si vous postulez d'un appareil mobile (téléphone intelligent, tablette), vous recevrez un courriel d'accusé réception vous demandant d'aller mettre à jour votre dossier et déposer votre CV afin que votre candidature soit prise en considération.
skills: ['Évalue et complète les documents pertinents en vue de l’obtention d’une vignette de stationnement pour les personnes à mobilité réduite ou pour l’accès au transport adapté;', 'Lorsque la situation clinique du résident l’exige, réfère vers le physiothérapeute ou l’ergothérapeute SAD;']

title: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist
description:
Location: Cranbrook

Details

Hospital: Cranbrook Veterinary Hospital

Type: Part-time Employment or Full-time Employment

Education: Diploma - Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Category: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Cranbrook Veterinary Hospital, located in the stunning East Kootenays of beautiful British Columbia is searching for an enthusiastic full-time RVT. Our established and friendly team of 2 Vets, 2 RVTs and an incredible support staff roster run a busy and successful Companion Animal Practice. We practice team-based medicine and have a longstanding tradition of providing exceptional care. Due to the growing demand for high-quality medicine in the area, we are now welcoming RVT applications from across Canada (relocation assistance provided). If you love veterinary medicine and enjoy being part of a fun and hard-working team, then we want to hear from you!

The city of Cranbrook is the largest urban center in the East Kootenays, and provides quick access for outdoor enthusiasts to world-renowned hiking, skiing, fishing, snowshoeing, kayaking, and river rafting. Enjoy all the amenities you’ll ever need, a vibrant cultural scene, and unparalleled opportunity to explore the mountains and rushing rivers surrounding Cranbrook.

You will be scheduled for 4 or 5 days on a rotating Monday – Friday schedule. There is no emergency On Call, but we do commit to after-hours appointments for current patients. With no weekend shifts, and flexibility to enjoy an additional day off each week, you'll have plenty of time to experience all the attractions the Cranbrook area has to offer. If you are an adventurous professional with a passion for the outdoors, don’t hesitate to learn more about this beautiful balance of work and play.

Our RVTs are fully utilized, and look forward to welcoming their next RVT team member. Our fully-equipped hospital features an in-house laboratory, digital x-ray, digital dental x-ray, a class 4 laser, ultrasound, and a computerized records systems (Avimark). Experienced RVTs will enjoy our welcoming and inclusive environment. We appreciate new perspectives and pride ourselves on collaboration and teamwork. New graduates will thrive too as our experienced RVTs are excited by the prospect of providing mentorship and taking someone under their wing. If you take pride in delivering outstanding client service, and want to wake up excited to go to work, don’t hesitate to contact us today.

Our clinic values our RVTs, and we prove it by supporting your personal, financial, and professional growth through:
  • Continuing Education (CE)
  • Competitive Wage
  • Extended Health Benefits package (Medical, Dental, & Vision premiums paid by clinic)
  • Professional Services coverage (chiropractor, massage therapist, physiotherapist, acupuncturist and more)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Paid Licensing & Membership Dues
  • Professional Liability Insurance coverage
  • Paid Vacation time
  • Paid Sick & Personal Days
  • Generous Veterinary Discounts (75% off services for your own pets, and an extended family and friends discount)
  • Uniform Allowance
  • Relocation allowance to help with moving expenses can be arranged for out-of-town candidates!
If you are looking for a progressive environment where each individual is heard, and recognized for their unique contributions, we'd love to talk.

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive, and diverse workplace.

Contact Information:Visit our website athttp://cranbrookveterinary.com/

Text or call Matt at 289-218-7041 to arrange an introductory conversation to learn more. Submit your CV tojobs@p3vetpartners.ca
skills: ['Generous Veterinary Discounts (75% off services for your own pets, and an extended family and friends discount)']

  • Doit détenir un diplôme d’études collégiales (DEC) en techniques de physiothérapie d’une école reconnue par le ministère compétent;
  • Doit être membre de l’Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec.

LES AVANTAGES QUE NOUS OFFRONS

Crédit d'impôt allant jusqu'à 10 000$ pour nouveau diplômé travaillant dans une région ressource éloignée disponible pour le secteur de la MRC de la Vallée-de-la-Gatineau.

Opportunité de travailler avec plusieurs types de clientèle.

Possibilité de travailler dans divers secteurs sur le territoire de l’Outaouais.

Possibilité de travailler à temps complet ou à temps partiel.

Programme d’orientation et d’intégration personnalisé.

Plan de mise à jour et développement des compétences.

Fond de pension intéressant.

Régime d’assurances collectives.

Congés fériés (ou bénéfices marginaux selon le statut).

4 semaines de vacances annuelles payées (ou bénéfices marginaux selon le statut).

LES AVANTAGES DE VIVRE EN OUTAOUAIS

Grand réseau de sentiers récréatifs (randonnée pédestre, ski de fond, raquette, motoneige) et pistes cyclables.

title: Conseiller au service / Service Advisor - Quebec, QC
description:
Conseiller au service

Le rôle

Tesla Motors recherche un conseiller en service expérimenté pour travailler sur l'une des marques de véhicules les plus progressistes au monde. Ce poste exige une interaction de haut niveau avec les clients et les employés, de sorte que le candidat idéal devra non seulement posséder un sens aigu de la technique, mais aussi la capacité de fournir un niveau élevé de service à la clientèle. Si vous souhaitez faire partie d'une équipe de service de classe mondiale soutenant la dernière technologie des véhicules électriques, nous sommes intéressés à vous entendre.

Responsabilité
  • Répondre aux appels téléphoniques, aux courriels et aux visites en voiture afin de résoudre les problèmes des clients avec le plus haut niveau de réponse et d'attention.
  • Retourner les appels téléphoniques et les courriels manqués dans un délai d'au moins 5 minutes.
  • Déterminer si la solution technique peut être résolue par téléphone ; transmettre immédiatement le problème au chef d'atelier ou au directeur de service pour qu'il soit traité immédiatement.
  • Enregistrer avec précision les problèmes et les données dans le système de gestion du concessionnaire. Le souci du détail est essentiel.
  • Effectuer des transactions avec le système ; guider le client dans la correction et lui fournir un résumé
  • Communiquer le temps de réalisation estimé, les mises à jour régulières et le suivi de chaque véhicule du client.
  • Coordonner les détails de chaque véhicule avant la livraison.
  • Coordonner l'heure de livraison ou d'enlèvement avec chaque client.
  • Faire un suivi avec le client sur les services fournis ; s'assurer qu'il est satisfait du travail effectué.
Exigences
  • Connaissance des méthodes, techniques, pièces, outils et matériaux utilisés pour l'entretien et la réparation des véhicules.
  • Expérience de l'utilisation opérationnelle et de l'entretien d'une grande variété d'outils électriques manuels, d'outils d'atelier et d'équipement d'essai automobile et électrique.
  • Compréhension des techniques automobiles de base liées à la réparation et à l'entretien des automobiles.
  • Capacité à suivre des instructions orales et écrites en prêtant attention aux détails.
  • Volonté d'apprendre des technologies automobiles nouvelles et innovantes.
  • Capacité d'établir et de maintenir des relations de travail coopératives avec les personnes contactées dans le cadre du travail, y compris le public.
  • Tenue de registres et de rapports quotidiens détaillés.
  • Gérer efficacement des priorités multiples, organiser la charge de travail et respecter les délais.
  • Travailler en équipe et atteindre un objectif commun.
  • Système(s) de gestion du concessionnaire, Outlook et MS Office.
  • Expérience dans le domaine du service automobile au détail, de préférence
  • Doit posséder et maintenir un permis de conduire valide et un dossier de conduite acceptable et sécuritaire.
  • Doit avoir deux ans d'expérience de conduite
Rémunération et avantages sociaux
  • La rémunération est basée sur une variété de facteurs, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, l'expérience professionnelle, les compétences, les certifications, etc.
  • Avantages pour les employés à temps plein En tant qu'employé à temps plein de Tesla, vous bénéficierez de ce qui suit :
  • Des avantages complets dès le premier jour pour vous et vos personnes à charge éligibles.
  • Assurance maladie complémentaire (y compris ostéopathe, psychologue et acupuncteur)
  • Assurance vision et dentaire
  • Assurance vie, AD&D, invalidité de courte et de longue durée payée par l'entreprise
  • Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER) collectif
  • Programme d'aide aux employés, congés de maladie et vacances (horaire flexible pour les postes salariaux) et congés payés.
  • Services de garde d'enfants et rabais pour les employés
Service Advisor

The Role

Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced Service Advisor to work on one of the most progressive vehicle brands in the world. This position requires a high-level customer and employee interaction, so the ideal candidate will not only possess the technical acumen, but also the ability to provide a strong level of customer service. If you are interested in becoming a part of a world-class service team supporting the latest EV technology, we are interested in hearing from you.

Responsibilities
  • Answer Phone Calls, Emails and Drive In’s to address any customer concern with the highest level of response and attention
  • Return missed phone calls, email in no less than 5 minutes
  • Determine if technical solution can be resolved over the phone; escalate immediately to Shop Foreman / Service Manager to provide immediate attention
  • Accurately record issues and data into Dealer Management System. Attention to detail critical
  • Conduct Transactions w/ system; walk customer through correction and provide summary
  • Communicate estimated completion time, regular updates and follow through on each customer vehicle
  • Coordinate the detail of every vehicle prior to delivery
  • Coordinate the delivery time or pick up with each customer
  • Follow up with Customer on services provided; ensure they are satisfied with the work performed
Requirements
  • Knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and materials used in the maintenance and repair of vehicles
  • Experience in operational use and maintenance of a wide variety of hand power tools, shop tools, and automotive and electrical test equipment
  • Understanding of basic automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of automobiles
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail
  • Willingness to learn new and innovative automotive technologies
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work to include the public
  • Perform detailed daily record keeping and reporting
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goal
  • Dealer Management System(s), Outlook, and MS Office
  • Retail automotive service experience, preferred
  • Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and an acceptable and safe driving record
  • Must have two years of driving experience
Compensation And Benefits

Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to work experience, skills, certifications, etc.

Full-time Employee Benefits

As a full-time Tesla employee, you will receive:
  • Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents
  • Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
  • Vision & Dental Insurance
  • Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
  • Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
  • Employee Assistance Program,
  • Sick and Vacation time (Flex Time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and employee discounts

title: PT early morning stocking
description:
Store - OTTAWA-SOUTH KEYES, ON

We're here for the Makers! Come be a part of the team where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Michaels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are here for all Team Members and all Makers to create, innovate and be better together.

To review a comprehensive list of benefits, please visit Michaels Benefits

Complete truck unload and merchandise duties throughout the store. Help customers shop and find what they are looking for. Deliver friendly customer service.

Major Activities

  • Adhere to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and Company programs to ensure compliance to applicable laws and requirements; execute Company policies and standards
  • Participate in truck un-load and stocking processes to ensure truck standards are followed and completed within budget
  • Participate in the planogram process (POG’s) in both SBA and seasonal to ensure they are complete timely and accurately
  • Participate in the AD set process on scheduled Sundays
  • Adhere to visual merchandising standards to ensure delivery of our brand promise to the customer
  • Merchandise recovery and go-backs
  • Help maintain seasonal sets and the feature space to our visual merchandising standards on a daily and weekly basis
  • Provide a well merchandised and in-stock store for the customer to shop
  • Acknowledge customers, help locate product and provide solutions
  • Interacts with others in an accepting and respectful manner; remains positive and respectful, even in difficult situations; promotes commitment to the organization’s vision and values; projects a positive image and serves as a role model for others
  • Support shrink and safety programs
  • Perform Store In Stock Optimization (SISO) duties as assigned
  • Operate cash register and line busting as assigned
  • Assist with Omni channel processes
  • Enroll customers in the Rewards program

Other Duties As Assigned

Preferred Type of experience the job requires

  • Retail merchandising and customer service experience preferred

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to remain standing for long periods of time
  • Ability to move throughout the store
  • Regular bending, lifting, carrying, reaching and stretching
  • Lifting heavy boxes and accessing high shelves by ladder or similar equipment
  • If you need help performing these functions of your job, please contact supervisor so that we may engage in the interactive process with you and find a reasonable accommodation

Work Environment

  • Public retail store setting taking care of our customers; all public areas are climate controlled; some stock rooms may not be climate controlled; some outdoor work if assigned to retrieve shopping carts or while unloading trucks; Frame shop contains glass cutter and heat press; work hours include nights, weekends and early mornings

Applicants in Canada must satisfy federal, provincial, and local legal requirements of the job.

Pour Découvrir La Beauté De L’outaouais

https://goo.gl/N4RvKc

Remarques

Veuillez prendre note qu'une protection adéquate contre la COVID-19 est obligatoire pour être embauché au sein du CISSS de l'Outaouais. À cet effet, vous devrez fournir la preuve que vous êtes adéquatement protégé lors de la complétion de votre formulaire pré-emploi.

Tous les employés du CISSS de l'Outaouais contribuent à offrir à la clientèle des soins et services pertinents, sécuritaires et de qualité.

Le CISSS de l'Outaouais souscrit au programme d'accès à l'égalité en emploi et invite les personnes issues des groupes visés (femmes, autochtones, minorités visibles / ethniques, personnes handicapées) à poser leur candidature.

Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais ne communiquerons qu’avec celles retenues pour une entrevue.

title: Service Advisor - Toronto, ON
description:
Service Advisor

This role is for our virtual team and is a work from home position.

The Role

Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced Service Advisor to work on one of the most progressive vehicle brands in the world. This position requires a high-level customer and employee interaction, so the ideal candidate will not only possess the technical acumen, but also the ability to provide a strong level of customer service. If you are interested in becoming a part of a world-class service team supporting the latest EV technology, we are interested in hearing from you.

Responsibilities
  • Answer Phone Calls, Emails and Drive In’s to address any customer concern with the highest level of response and attention
  • Return missed phone calls, email in no less than 5 minutes
  • Determine if technical solution can be resolved over the phone; escalate immediately to Shop Foreman / Service Manager to provide immediate attention
  • Accurately record issues and data into Dealer Management System. Attention to detail critical
  • Conduct Transactions w/ system; walk customer through correction and provide summary
  • Communicate estimated completion time, regular updates and follow through on each customer vehicle
  • Coordinate the detail of every vehicle prior to delivery
  • Coordinate the delivery time or pick up with each customer
  • Follow up with Customer on services provided; ensure they are satisfied with the work performed
Requirements
  • Knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and materials used in the maintenance and repair of vehicles
  • Experience in operational use and maintenance of a wide variety of hand power tools, shop tools, and automotive and electrical test equipment
  • Understanding of basic automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of automobiles
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail
  • Willingness to learn new and innovative automotive technologies
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work to include the public
  • Perform detailed daily record keeping and reporting
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goal
  • Dealer Management System(s), Outlook, and MS Office
  • Retail automotive service experience, preferred
  • Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and an acceptable and safe driving record
  • Must have two years of driving experience
Compensation And Benefits

Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to work experience, skills, certifications, etc.

Full-time Employee Benefits As a full-time Tesla employee, you will receive:
  • Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents
  • Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
  • Vision & Dental Insurance
  • Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
  • Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
  • Employee Assistance Program, Sick and Vacation time (Flex Time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and employee discounts

Attention to detail critical', 'Retail automotive service experience, preferred', 'Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines', 'Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents', 'Must have two years of driving experience']

title: Registered Massage Therapist - South Point
description:
Position: Registered Massage Therapist

Locations: South Point, South Surrey

Work Status: Full - time or Part - time

Work Classification: Contractor

As a RMT at Legacies, we take pride in our vision to provide excellent care in an integrated clinical work environment. We have a team of inter-disciplinary healthcare professionals such as Chiropractors, ND, Kinesiologist, Acupuncturist and Physiotherapist working in one location to provide a broad scope of services to clients. Our location is in a convenient area and is easily accessible. The clinic is well structured and is considered a state of the art facility.

RMT Duties Will Include
  • Providing professional massage and body treatments in accordance with clinic protocols and accepted certification practices.
  • Welcoming clients and ensure a comfortable and professional experience
  • Ensuring that services are provided on time per each massage appointment and perform services within the appropriate time allotted for the service.
  • With the support of the Administration team, maintain the treatment rooms organized and neat with adequate supply of products and linens, cleaning and instrument sterilization.
  • Working with senior leadership or independently in building a robust massage therapy client base.
  • Assisting with strategic marketing initiatives to contribute to the clinic's overall business development.
  • Completing required client notes, maintaining accurate documentation and filing of client files.
  • Ensuring a collaborative, productive and professional relationships within the team by consistently contributing ideas and skills toward a respectful and thriving workplace.
Our practitioners are highly paid and receive amazing opportunities such as:
  • Fully booked practice (we have a wait-list every day, sometimes over 70 people long!).
  • $$ Signing Bonus $$
  • Just a 6-hr shifts!
  • Continuing Education Seminars, Courses, and Grand Round Experiences.
  • Fully-equipped rehab gym, treatment rooms with hi-lo tables, computers for online charting.
  • Full administration support including laundry, invoicing, third-part billings, money collections, bookkeeping, marketing and promotional materials
Apply through the link or

Contact

Offie Lastimoza, Sr. Human Resources Manager at offie.lastimoza@legacieshealthcentre.ca for more information.

title: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist
description:
Location: Kelowna

Details

Hospital: Pawsitive Veterinary Care

Type: Part-time Employment or Full-time Employment

Education: Diploma - Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Category: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Team Pawsitive is looking to add another RVT to our team!

We are an integrative-holistic small animal clinic located in beautiful Kelowna, BC and have been in operation since 2000. Our vision at Pawsitive is to become a veterinary clinic that draws clients from a wide area due to a superb reputation. We strive to maintain this by offering the best health care possible with an unwavering focus on the holistic options available whilst using conventional care and diagnostics when necessary.

We are looking for someone who is a team player and has strong technical skills, is warm, friendly and exhibits excellent communication abilities. Join us at this exciting time as we transition to a brand new state-of-the-art 3700 square foot facility. If you’re searching for a supportive clinic that understands the value of client education, preventative medicine and work-life balance, search no further! New grads or experienced RVT's looking to get their feet wet (or dabble in) some holistic health options while using tried and true conventional approaches are both welcome.

Key Duties & Responsibilities
  • Communicate in a compassionate and professional manner with clients and fellow veterinary care team members using efficient oral and written communication skills.
  • Administer and analyze diagnostic tests (hematology, clinical chemistry, cytology, urinalysis, etc.) utilizing appropriate equipment and techniques.
  • Assist Veterinarian with surgical and therapeutic procedures. Utilize gold-standard patient care techniques, ensuring operating room environment complies with all aseptic standards and protocols.
  • Administer and monitor anesthesia and analgesia in accordance with the veterinary scope of practice and provincial laws governing the RVT profession.
  • Provide excellent veterinary nursing care in a professional and ethical manner through the synthesis of veterinary theory, principles and concepts (including Fear Free techniques) within the scope of regulations dictated by the provincial governing laws of the profession.
  • Document and maintain accurate veterinary medical records, following regulated procedures and standards.
  • Operate and maintain state-of-the-art veterinary medical equipment, following health and safety regulations in accordance with veterinary profession standards.
  • Execute and evaluate quality diagnostic images utilizing knowledge of theory, principles and concepts.
  • Perform dental procedures in compliance with professional veterinary industry standards, employing an in-depth knowledge of dental structures, conditions and lesions, causes and stages of diseases.
  • Manage multiple priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Maintain an appropriate inventory of all medical supplies as determined by veterinary office inventory control procedures.
  • Maintain and support a collaborative work environment and assist other staff members as required.
Qualifications
  • Graduate of an accredited program for Veterinary Technologists is required.
  • Registered Veterinary Technology designation preferred
Total Compensation

Our clinic values our RVTs, and we prove it by supporting your personal, financial, and professional growth through:
  • Continuing Education (CE)
  • A Competitive Wage Rate
  • A Comprehensive Health Benefits Package (Medical, Dental, & Vision premiums paid by clinic)
  • Professional Services Coverage (chiropractor, massage therapist, physiotherapist, acupuncturist and more)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Paid Licensing & Membership Dues
  • Paid Vacation time
  • Paid Sick & Personal Days
  • Generous Veterinary Discounts (75% off services for your own pets, and an extended family and friends discount)
  • Uniform Allowance
  • Signing Bonus to help with moving expenses can be arranged for out-of-town candidates
Contact Information: Visit our website at https://pawsitivevetcare.com/ to learn more; submit your CV to Dr. Moira at drmoira@gmail.com

title: Commis Centre Jardin PT, jour
description:
"Nous recherchons des collègues de talent qui aiment par-dessus tout offrir une expérience de magasinage exceptionnelle à nos clients en veillant à leur faire plaisir à chaque étape!

À titre de collègue dans l’un de nos magasins, vous aurez une répercussion immédiate sur les ventes et sur la satisfaction du client en :
  • Offrant un service à la clientèle exceptionnel;
  • Assurant le bon balayage des produits;
  • Adoptant les promotions et les programmes proposés par l’entreprise;
  • Entretenant les étalages de produit.

Chez Loblaw, nous sommes déterminés à respecter l’environnement, à assurer un approvisionnement intègre et à faire une différence positive dans la communauté. Nous offrons à nos collègues des carrières évolutives, une formation complète, une grande flexibilité et d’excellents avantages sociaux!"

title: TECHNOLOGUE EN PHYSIOTHÉRAPIE- CHSLD L'ASSOMPTION- RÉADAPTATION EN DÉFICIENCE PHYSIQUE- REMPLACEMENT TEMPS COMPLET LONG TERME
description:
Description

Personne qui contribue à l'évaluation des déficiences et des incapacités de la fonction physique reliées aux systèmes neurologique, musculosquelettique et cardiorespiratoire. Elle détermine un plan de traitement et réalise les interventions dans le but d'obtenir un rendement fonctionnel optimal lorsqu'elle dispose préalablement d'une évaluation faite par un physiothérapeute ou d'un diagnostic médical non limité aux symptômes qui indique, s'il y a lieu, le type de structure atteinte et qui est accompagné d'un dossier documentant l'atteinte. Elle peut participer à l'enseignement clinique.

Exigences

Doit détenir un diplôme d'études collégiales (DEC) en techniques de physiothérapie d'une école reconnue par le ministère compétent.

Doit être membre de l'Ordre professionnel de la physiothérapie du Québec.

DOIT ÊTRE ÉGALEMENT ADÉQUATEMENT PROTÉGÉ CONTRE LA COVID-19

Remarques

Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui poseront leur candidature, mais nous communiquerons qu’avec celles retenues pour un processus de sélection.

Le CISSS de Lanaudière applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité en emploi et invite les Autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques, les femmes et les personnes handicapées à présenter leur candidature. Les personnes handicapées peuvent également nous faire part de leurs besoins particuliers relativement au processus de sélection pour l'emploi sollicité afin de faciliter l'étude de leur candidature.

Si vous postulez d'un appareil mobile (téléphone intelligent, tablette), vous recevrez un courriel d'accusé réception vous demandant d'aller mettre à jour votre dossier et déposer votre CV afin que votre candidature soit prise en considération.

title: Conseiller au service / Service Advisor - Laval, QC (Temps partiel)
description:
Conseiller au service
  • Ce rôle est temps partiel de fin de semaine
Le rôle

Tesla Motors recherche un conseiller en service expérimenté pour travailler sur l'une des marques de véhicules les plus progressistes au monde. Ce poste exige une interaction de haut niveau avec les clients et les employés, de sorte que le candidat idéal devra non seulement posséder un sens aigu de la technique, mais aussi la capacité de fournir un niveau élevé de service à la clientèle. Si vous souhaitez faire partie d'une équipe de service de classe mondiale soutenant la dernière technologie des véhicules électriques, nous sommes intéressés à vous entendre.

Responsabilité
  • Répondre aux appels téléphoniques, aux courriels et aux visites en voiture afin de résoudre les problèmes des clients avec le plus haut niveau de réponse et d'attention.
  • Retourner les appels téléphoniques et les courriels manqués dans un délai d'au moins 5 minutes.
  • Déterminer si la solution technique peut être résolue par téléphone ; transmettre immédiatement le problème au chef d'atelier ou au directeur de service pour qu'il soit traité immédiatement.
  • Enregistrer avec précision les problèmes et les données dans le système de gestion du concessionnaire. Le souci du détail est essentiel.
  • Effectuer des transactions avec le système ; guider le client dans la correction et lui fournir un résumé
  • Communiquer le temps de réalisation estimé, les mises à jour régulières et le suivi de chaque véhicule du client.
  • Coordonner les détails de chaque véhicule avant la livraison.
  • Coordonner l'heure de livraison ou d'enlèvement avec chaque client.
  • Faire un suivi avec le client sur les services fournis ; s'assurer qu'il est satisfait du travail effectué.
Exigences
  • Connaissance des méthodes, techniques, pièces, outils et matériaux utilisés pour l'entretien et la réparation des véhicules.
  • Expérience de l'utilisation opérationnelle et de l'entretien d'une grande variété d'outils électriques manuels, d'outils d'atelier et d'équipement d'essai automobile et électrique.
  • Compréhension des techniques automobiles de base liées à la réparation et à l'entretien des automobiles.
  • Capacité à suivre des instructions orales et écrites en prêtant attention aux détails.
  • Volonté d'apprendre des technologies automobiles nouvelles et innovantes.
  • Capacité d'établir et de maintenir des relations de travail coopératives avec les personnes contactées dans le cadre du travail, y compris le public.
  • Tenue de registres et de rapports quotidiens détaillés.
  • Gérer efficacement des priorités multiples, organiser la charge de travail et respecter les délais.
  • Travailler en équipe et atteindre un objectif commun.
  • Système(s) de gestion du concessionnaire, Outlook et MS Office.
  • Expérience dans le domaine du service automobile au détail, de préférence
  • Doit posséder et maintenir un permis de conduire valide et un dossier de conduite acceptable et sécuritaire.
  • Doit avoir deux ans d'expérience de conduite
Rémunération et avantages sociaux
  • La rémunération est basée sur une variété de facteurs, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, l'expérience professionnelle, les compétences, les certifications, etc.
  • Avantages pour les employés à temps plein En tant qu'employé à temps plein de Tesla, vous bénéficierez de ce qui suit :
  • Des avantages complets dès le premier jour pour vous et vos personnes à charge éligibles.
  • Assurance maladie complémentaire (y compris ostéopathe, psychologue et acupuncteur)
  • Assurance vision et dentaire
  • Assurance vie, AD&D, invalidité de courte et de longue durée payée par l'entreprise
  • Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER) collectif
  • Programme d'aide aux employés, congés de maladie et vacances (horaire flexible pour les postes salariaux) et congés payés.
  • Services de garde d'enfants et rabais pour les employés
Service Advisor
  • This role is part-time for a weekend schedule
The Role

Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced Service Advisor to work on one of the most progressive vehicle brands in the world. This position requires a high-level customer and employee interaction, so the ideal candidate will not only possess the technical acumen, but also the ability to provide a strong level of customer service. If you are interested in becoming a part of a world-class service team supporting the latest EV technology, we are interested in hearing from you.

Responsibilities
  • Answer Phone Calls, Emails and Drive In’s to address any customer concern with the highest level of response and attention
  • Return missed phone calls, email in no less than 5 minutes
  • Determine if technical solution can be resolved over the phone; escalate immediately to Shop Foreman / Service Manager to provide immediate attention
  • Accurately record issues and data into Dealer Management System. Attention to detail critical
  • Conduct Transactions w/ system; walk customer through correction and provide summary
  • Communicate estimated completion time, regular updates and follow through on each customer vehicle
  • Coordinate the detail of every vehicle prior to delivery
  • Coordinate the delivery time or pick up with each customer
  • Follow up with Customer on services provided; ensure they are satisfied with the work performed
Requirements
  • Knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and materials used in the maintenance and repair of vehicles
  • Experience in operational use and maintenance of a wide variety of hand power tools, shop tools, and automotive and electrical test equipment
  • Understanding of basic automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of automobiles
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail
  • Willingness to learn new and innovative automotive technologies
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work to include the public
  • Perform detailed daily record keeping and reporting
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goal
  • Dealer Management System(s), Outlook, and MS Office
  • Retail automotive service experience, preferred
  • Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and an acceptable and safe driving record
  • Must have two years of driving experience
Compensation And Benefits

Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to work experience, skills, certifications, etc.

Full-time Employee Benefits

As a full-time Tesla employee, you will receive:
  • Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents
  • Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
  • Vision & Dental Insurance
  • Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
  • Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
  • Employee Assistance Program,
  • Sick and Vacation time (Flex Time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and employee discounts

title: Registered Massage Therapist - North Vancouver
description:
Position: Registered Massage Therapist

Work Status: Full - time or Part - time

Work Classification: Contractor

Legacies Healthcare Centre (LHC) is a Back in Motion subsidiary. As a RMT at Legacies, we take pride in our vision to provide excellent care in an integrated clinical work environment. We have a team of inter-disciplinary healthcare professionals such as Chiropractors, ND, Kinesiologist, Acupuncturist and Physiotherapist working in one location to provide a broad scope of services to clients. Our location is in a convenient area and is easily accessible. The clinic is well structured and is considered a state of the art facility.

RMT Duties Will Include
  • Providing professional massage and body treatments in accordance with clinic protocols and accepted certification practices.
  • Welcoming clients and ensure a comfortable and professional experience
  • Ensuring that services are provided on time per each massage appointment and perform services within the appropriate time allotted for the service.
  • With the support of the Administration team, maintain the treatment rooms organized and neat with adequate supply of products and linens, cleaning and instrument sterilization.
  • Working with senior leadership or independently in building a robust massage therapy client base.
  • Assisting with strategic marketing initiatives to contribute to the clinic's overall business development.
  • Completing required client notes, maintaining accurate documentation and filing of client files.
  • Ensuring a collaborative, productive and professional relationships within the team by consistently contributing ideas and skills toward a respectful and thriving workplace.
Our practitioners are highly paid and receive amazing opportunities such as:
  • Fully booked practice
  • Just a 6-hr shifts
  • Continuing Education Seminars, Courses, and Grand Round Experiences.
  • Fully-equipped rehab gym, treatment rooms with hi-lo tables, computers for online charting.
  • Full administration support including laundry, invoicing, third-part billings, money collections, bookkeeping, marketing and promotional materials
Apply through the link or

Contact

Offie Lastimoza at offie.lastimoza@legacieshealthcentre.ca for more information.

title: Vehicle Detailer (2pm -11pm) - Oakville, ON
description:
We are looking for a Vehicle Detailer to work on one of the most progressive vehicles in the world. Exceptional 'hands on' technical ability go hand in hand with a great work ethic. Communication is highly important. Excellent Oral and Written communication required. If you are able to deliver strong customer satisfaction consistently, are motivated and a team player, we are interested in speaking with you.

Responsibilities
  • Performs entry-level work in the inspection, repair, and service of Tesla electric vehicles.
  • Operate a variety of hand, power, and shop tools.
  • Perform equipment inspections, adjustments and certifications.
  • Maintain records of time and materials.
  • May order shop supplies and parts.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.
  • Help maintain vehicle cleanliness of customer cars.
  • Support journeymen technicians as needed
  • Knowledge of: Methods, techniques for detailing vehicles - wet sand, polish, buff, wax, etc.
  • Efficient skills in basic automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of automobiles.
Requirements
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail.
  • Willingness to learn new and innovative automotive technologies.
  • Establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work, including the public.
  • Perform detailed daily record keeping and reporting.
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines.
  • Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goals.
  • Clean driving record is imperative
  • High School Diploma.
  • Associate Degree or Certificate in Automotive Technology a plus
  • Retail automotive service experience a plus.
  • Valid driver’s license in the country in which you are applying, 2 year minimum driving record required with a clean driving history, and ability to be insured.
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
Full-time Employee Benefits

As a full-time Tesla employee, you will receive:
  • Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents
  • Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
  • Vision & Dental Insurance
  • Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability

title: CNC Roll formimg operator
description:
The Role
As an essential member of the Canadian Metal Buildings Production Team, and as the champion of the CNC Roll-Form Mill, The Operator’s main focus is quality. Quality is at the foundation of everything we do, and when operating the CNC Forming Mill, Quality means: performing regular and preventative maintenance and repairs, diligent mechanical adjustments, managing operating procedures and schedules, precision measurement, keen attention to detail, effective mathematics and data analysis skills and the handling and organization of production parts with care.
The CNC Roll-Form Mill is a sophisticated and complex machine that cold-forms steel coils into Purlins and structural steel members. The parts that this machine produces are heavy and expensive, so a great deal of responsibility and care is required at all-times.
The Operator must be able to operate an overhead crane, must be able to lift steel over 100 lbs, and must have an excellent mechanical and mathematical aptitude. To excel as an Operator you must have a thorough understanding of mechanical systems, have accurate data input, math and analysis skills, have high-level critical thinking skills and an intrinsic drive for hussle and productivity.
The Cold-Form Mill Operator is responsible for all of our secondary structural parts, which means being focused and reliable. If a part is incorrect, that error must be immediately identified, recorded, tracked and then the mistake must be properly diagnosed and the machine must be mechanically adjusted to eliminate the error. The operator is also accountable for planning production and ensuring delivery of parts is on time, within tolerance and within budget.
To succeed at Canadian Metal Buildings you must be energetic, passionate, highly organized and hard-working. Quality and Innovation are at the core of everything we do at Canadian Metal buildings. Everyone at Canadian Metal Buildings is friendly, positive and passionate and our culture is very important to us. We love what we do and we truly are building better buildings and better lives every day.
We are hiring for full-time positions for day and afternoon shifts.
Responsibilities
● Program the CNC Roll-Form Mill, including data entry and a basic understanding of software and controls
● Reliably interpret CAD drawings and structural drawings
● Safely load and transport steel coils using an overhead crane
● Diagnose, adjust, repair and maintain a complex mechanical system using a wide variety of
hand tools
● Safely operate a grinder, drill and other power tools
● Accurately learn and remember detailed operating procedures while recording and tracking
data and measurements
● Unload, lift, stack and band parts over 100lbs
● Accurately measure lengths and angles

● Schedule, organize and manage projects
● Work as a team as well as direct and aid other colleagues with priority tasks, including
material handling, organization and labour tasks.
● Perform additional responsibilities as assigned to meet business needs
Requirements
● Strong Mechanical Aptitude
● 2 years in a mechanical role or in the steel industry (Engineering Experience a Bonus)
● Positive, enthusiastic and passionate
● Ability to understand and convey technical concepts
● Strong sense of team mentality and reliability
● Great attention to detail with strong organization and communication skills
● Strong Mathematics Skills
● Must have a Driver’s Licence and a Reliable vehicle
● Must be able to successfully pass a pre-employment background check
● Legal right to work in Canada
Compensation
Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to work experience, skills, certifications, etc.
19$/hour - 25$/hour
Probationary period starts at 19$/hour and compensation will be reviewed upon completion of probation (3 months), and subsequently thereafter every 6 months. We are happy to provide hard-working and passionate employees with a competitive long-term career path.
Full-time Employee Benefits as a Canadian Metal Buildings employee:
● Full benefits after 3 months for you and your eligible dependents
● Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
● Vision & Dental Insurance
● Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
● Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) & Deferred Profit Sharing Program
● Employee Assistance Program, Sick and Vacation time (Flex Time for salary positions), and
Paid Holidays

title: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist
description:
Location: Calgary

Details

Hospital: Stoney Trail Veterinary Clinic

Type: Part-time Employment or Full-time Employment

Education: Diploma - Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Category: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Calling all RVTs that love the Mountains!

Stoney Trail Veterinary Clinic in NW Calgary is a well-respected Small Animal practice that values open communication, preventative medicine, teamwork, and impeccable client care. If you’re searching for a progressive clinic, work-life balance, and a supportive culture - search no further!

With Banff just a 1-hour drive from the clinic, you'll appreciate quick access to all the incredible outdoor activities the Rocky Mountains have to offer, while simultaneously enjoying Calgary's vibrant cultural scene, amenities, affordability, and the world-renowned Stampede. Mountain hiking and biking, skiing, fishing, snowshoeing, kayaking, river rafting… it's all possible in this area! This is an unparalleled opportunity to live a beautiful balance of work and play. We are happy to offer a part-time or full-time schedule. There is no On Call. If you're passionate about high-quality medicine and exploring the Great Canadian Outdoors, you can’t afford to miss this opportunity.

Key Duties & Responsibilities
  • Communicate in a compassionate and professional manner with clients and fellow veterinary care team members using efficient oral and written communication skills.
  • Administer and analyze diagnostic tests (hematology, clinical chemistry, cytology, urinalysis, etc.) utilizing appropriate equipment and techniques.
  • Assist Veterinarian with surgical and therapeutic procedures. Utilize gold-standard patient care techniques, ensuring operating room environment complies with all aseptic standards and protocols.
  • Administer and monitor anesthesia and analgesia in accordance with the veterinary scope of practice and provincial laws governing the RVT profession.
  • Provide excellent veterinary nursing care in a professional and ethical manner through the synthesis of veterinary theory, principles and concepts (including Fear Free techniques) within the scope of regulations dictated by the provincial governing laws of the profession.
  • Document and maintain accurate veterinary medical records, following regulated procedures and standards.
  • Operate and maintain state-of-the-art veterinary medical equipment, following health and safety regulations in accordance with veterinary profession standards.
  • Execute and evaluate quality diagnostic images utilizing knowledge of theory, principles and concepts.
  • Perform dental procedures in compliance with professional veterinary industry standards, employing an in-depth knowledge of dental structures, conditions and lesions, causes and stages of diseases.
  • Manage multiple priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Maintain an appropriate inventory of all medical supplies as determined by veterinary office inventory control procedures.
  • Maintain and support a collaborative work environment and assist other staff members as required.
Total Compensation

Our clinic values our RVTs, and we prove it by supporting your personal, financial, and professional growth through:
  • Continuing Education (CE)
  • A Competitive Wage Rate
  • A Comprehensive Health Benefits Package (Medical, Dental, & Vision premiums paid by clinic)
  • Professional Services Coverage (chiropractor, massage therapist, physiotherapist, acupuncturist and more)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Paid Licensing & Membership Dues
  • Paid Vacation time
  • Paid Sick & Personal Days
  • Generous Veterinary Discounts (75% off services for your own pets, and an extended family and friends discount)
  • Uniform Allowance
  • Signing Bonus to help with moving expenses can be arranged for out-of-town candidates
If you are looking for a progressive environment where each individual is heard, and recognized for their unique contributions, we'd love to talk.

Visit our website at: www.stvc.ca

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive, and diverse workplace.

title: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist (Veterinary Rehabilitation Position)
description:
Location: Owen Sound

Details

Hospital: Grey Bruce Pet Hospital

Type: Part-time Employment or Full-time Employment

Education: Diploma - Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Category: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Are you an RVT interested or experienced in veterinary rehabilitation? If so, we have an amazing opportunity for you!

We are looking for a full-time, energetic and fun rehab RVT to join us at Grey Bruce Pet Hospital. We have 6 DVMs, 7 RVTs, an amazing support team, and we are a well-equipped, AAHA-accredited companion animal hospital in Owen Sound, ON. We celebrate best practices in medicine, surgery, dentistry, preventative health care, digital thermal imaging, acupuncture, rehabilitation, chiropractic, traditional Chinese medicine & reproductive services. Join us as we enter our brand-new state-of-the-art facility in April. This building will feature an entire rehabilitation wing with an underwater treadmill, laser, chiropractic care, and stem cell therapy.

Our ideal candidate will have familiarity with rehab exercises, regenerative therapies such as stem cell therapy and PRP therapy, laser therapy, acupuncture, and spinal manipulation therapy. We are willing to train RVTs with an interest in rehabilitation. Even though rehab will be your primary focus, you will have the opportunity to perform technician appointments (boosters, nutrition consults, injections, cystocentesis and more), anesthesia, lab work as well as general and ICU patient care.

Owen Sound’s tagline is literally “Where you want to live!” You only have to visit to understand why. It is a growing, family-oriented city located in the heart of beautiful Grey County. This is a community with small town values and big city services! What truly sets our area apart is the outdoor activities, from swimming in Georgian Bay to skiing at Blue Mountain as well as hiking the Niagara Escarpment!

Key Duties & Responsibilities
  • Communicate in a compassionate and professional manner with clients and fellow veterinary care team members using efficient oral and written communication skills.
  • Administer and analyze diagnostic tests (hematology, clinical chemistry, cytology, urinalysis, etc.) utilizing appropriate equipment and techniques.
  • Assist Veterinarian with surgical and therapeutic procedures. Utilize gold-standard patient care techniques, ensuring operating room environment complies with all aseptic standards and protocols.
  • Administer and monitor anesthesia and analgesia in accordance with the veterinary scope of practice and provincial laws governing the RVT profession.
  • Provide excellent veterinary nursing care in a professional and ethical manner through the synthesis of veterinary theory, principles and concepts (including Fear Free techniques) within the scope of regulations dictated by the provincial governing laws of the profession.
  • Document and maintain accurate veterinary medical records, following regulated procedures and standards.
  • Operate and maintain state-of-the-art veterinary medical equipment, following health and safety regulations in accordance with veterinary profession standards.
  • Execute and evaluate quality diagnostic images utilizing knowledge of theory, principles and concepts.
  • Perform dental procedures in compliance with professional veterinary industry standards, employing an in-depth knowledge of dental structures, conditions and lesions, causes and stages of diseases.
  • Manage multiple priorities simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  • Maintain an appropriate inventory of all medical supplies as determined by veterinary office inventory control procedures.
  • Maintain and support a collaborative work environment and assist other staff members as required.
Total Compensation

Our clinic values our RVTs, and we prove it by supporting your personal, financial, and professional growth through:
  • Continuing Education (CE)
  • A Competitive Wage Rate
  • A Comprehensive Health Benefits Package (Medical, Dental, & Vision premiums paid by clinic)
  • Professional Services Coverage (chiropractor, massage therapist, physiotherapist, acupuncturist and more)
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Paid Licensing & Membership Dues
  • Paid Vacation time
  • Paid Sick & Personal Days
  • Generous Veterinary Discounts (75% off services for your own pets, and an extended family and friends discount)
  • Uniform Allowance
  • Signing Bonus to help with moving expenses can be arranged for out-of-town candidates
If you are looking for a progressive environment where each individual is heard, and recognized for their unique contributions, we'd love to talk.

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing a respectful, inclusive, and diverse workplace.

Visit our website at: https://greybrucepethospital.com

title: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist
description:
Location: Castlegar

Details

Hospital: Castlegar Veterinary Hospital

Type: Part-time Employment or Full-time Employment

Education: Diploma - Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Category: Registered Veterinary Technician/Technologist

Castlegar Veterinary Hospital is expanding, and would like to add another RVT to our amazing team! If you're searching for a collaborative and progressive culture, supportive team members, incredible clients, and an opportunity to practice gold-standard care, come to Castlegar! Our team is driven to provide the level of service and care we would expect for our own pets. Everything we do is grounded in our focus on providing the best possible medical, surgical, and preventative care. This is an outstanding opportunity to advance your career with a team that prioritizes preventative medicine and client education while fully utilizing your RVT skills.

Castlegar is the second-largest community in the beautiful West Kootenay Mountains, located at the confluence of the Kootenay and Columbia rivers. If you enjoy outdoor activities like hiking, kayaking, and fishing, and you're ready to love where you work and play, you can't afford to miss this opportunity!

A team-based approach to medicine is our top priority. The culture of our practice values open communication, equality, and impeccable client care. Our ideal candidate is a team player with excellent communication skills. We work hard and have fun together every day, so it's important that we identify someone with an enthusiastic and agreeable disposition that shares our enthusiasm for veterinary medicine. If you set others up for success, assume positive intent, and foster open, genuine, and cooperative relationships - want to hear from you!

title: Service Advisor - Kitchener, ON
description:
Service Advisor

The Role

Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced Service Advisor to work on one of the most progressive vehicle brands in the world. This position requires a high-level customer and employee interaction, so the ideal candidate will not only possess the technical acumen, but also the ability to provide a strong level of customer service. If you are interested in becoming a part of a world-class service team supporting the latest EV technology, we are interested in hearing from you.

Responsibilities
  • Answer Phone Calls, Emails and Drive In’s to address any customer concern with the highest level of response and attention
  • Return missed phone calls, email in no less than 5 minutes
  • Determine if technical solution can be resolved over the phone; escalate immediately to Shop Foreman / Service Manager to provide immediate attention
  • Accurately record issues and data into Dealer Management System. Attention to detail critical
  • Conduct Transactions w/ system; walk customer through correction and provide summary
  • Communicate estimated completion time, regular updates and follow through on each customer vehicle
  • Coordinate the detail of every vehicle prior to delivery
  • Coordinate the delivery time or pick up with each customer
  • Follow up with Customer on services provided; ensure they are satisfied with the work performed
Requirements
  • Knowledge of methods, techniques, parts, tools and materials used in the maintenance and repair of vehicles
  • Experience in operational use and maintenance of a wide variety of hand power tools, shop tools, and automotive and electrical test equipment
  • Understanding of basic automotive techniques related to repair and servicing of automobiles
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions with attention to detail
  • Willingness to learn new and innovative automotive technologies
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work to include the public
  • Perform detailed daily record keeping and reporting
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Work in a team-based environment and achieve common goal
  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • Dealer Management System(s), Outlook, and MS Office
  • Associate Degree or certificate in Automotive Technology, preferred
  • Retail automotive service experience, preferred
  • Must have and maintain a valid driver’s license and an acceptable and safe driving record
  • Must have two years of driving experience
Compensation And Benefits

Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to work experience, skills, certifications, etc.

Full-time Employee Benefits

As a full-time Tesla employee, you will receive:
  • Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents
  • Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
  • Vision & Dental Insurance
  • Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
  • Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
  • Employee Assistance Program, Sick and Vacation time (Flex Time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and employee discounts

title: Technicien Mobile Spécialiste des Pneus / Mobile Tire Technician - Laval, QC
description:
Technicien de pneus mobile

Le rôle

Vous Trouverez Plus De Détails Sur Le Poste Ci-dessous

Tesla Motors est à la recherche d'un technicien mobile expérimenté en matière de pneus pour travailler sur l'une des marques de véhicules les plus progressistes au monde. Ce poste exige une interaction importante avec les clients, de sorte que le candidat idéal doit non seulement posséder un sens aigu de la technique, mais aussi la capacité de fournir un niveau élevé de service à la clientèle. Ce poste desservira la région de ______ ; toutefois, le poste nécessitera des déplacements quotidiens dans la région sous la direction de l'équipe de répartition des pneus mobiles. Si vous souhaitez faire partie d'une équipe de service de classe mondiale qui soutient la dernière technologie des véhicules électriques, nous sommes intéressés à vous entendre.

Responsabilités
  • Effectuer des travaux de niveau apprenti dans le cadre de l'inspection, de la réparation et de l'entretien des véhicules électriques Tesla.
  • Utiliser une variété d'outils manuels, électriques et d'atelier.
  • Effectuer des inspections, des ajustements et des certifications de l'équipement
  • Tenir des registres du temps, des dépenses et des matériaux
  • Effectuer d'autres tâches connexes selon les besoins
  • Aider à maintenir la propreté des véhicules
  • Gérer efficacement des priorités multiples, organiser la charge de travail et respecter les délais.
  • Soutenir les autres techniciens du service mobile et les centres de service Tesla, si nécessaire.
  • Déplacements régionaux quotidiens
Exigences
  • Connaissance des méthodes et techniques d'entretien et de réparation des véhicules
  • Compréhension et formation sur le montage et l'équilibrage des pneus et la réparation des pneus.
  • Formation dans une école professionnelle/ ASE un plus.
  • Excellentes aptitudes à la communication orale et écrite et capacité à suivre des instructions.
  • Capacité à établir et à maintenir des relations de travail coopératives avec les personnes contactées dans le cadre du travail, y compris le public et de multiples intervenants internes.
  • Capacité d'apprendre et de s'adapter rapidement à de nouveaux systèmes et processus, ainsi qu'à un environnement de travail dynamique.
  • Être prêt à obtenir la certification DOT
  • Expérience de la conduite d'une remorque
  • Doit être à l'aise avec les déplacements régionaux quotidiens et la conduite d'un grand véhicule de service.
  • Doit faire preuve d'un sens de l'urgence lorsqu'il s'agit de répondre aux besoins d'assistance routière des clients.
  • Excellente capacité de service à la clientèle et de résolution de problèmes
Rémunération et avantages sociaux

La rémunération est basée sur une variété de facteurs, y compris, mais sans s'y limiter, l'expérience de travail, les compétences, les certifications, etc.

Avantages pour les employés à temps plein

En tant qu'employé à temps plein de Tesla, vous bénéficierez de ce qui suit :
  • Des avantages complets dès le premier jour pour vous et vos personnes à charge éligibles.
  • Assurance maladie complémentaire (y compris ostéopathe, psychologue et acupuncteur)
  • Assurance vision et dentaire
  • Assurance vie, AD&D, invalidité de courte et de longue durée payée par l'entreprise
  • Régime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER) collectif
  • Programme d'aide aux employés, congés de maladie et vacances (horaire flexible pour les postes salariaux) et congés payés.
  • Services de garde d'enfants et rabais pour les employés
Mobile Tire Technician

The Role

Responsibilities

Tesla Motors is looking for an experienced Mobile Tire Technician to work on one of the most progressive vehicle brands in the world. This position requires a significant amount of customer interaction, so the ideal candidate will not only possess the technical acumen, but also the ability to provide a strong level of customer service. This position will service the ______ area; however, the role will require daily travel within the region directed by Mobile Tire Dispatch team. If you are interested in becoming a part of a world-class service team supporting the latest EV technology, we are interested in hearing from you. More details about the job are listed below:
  • Performs apprentice level work in the inspection, repair, and service of Tesla electric vehicles
  • Operate a variety of hand, power, and shop tools
  • Perform equipment inspections, adjustments and certifications
  • Maintain records of time, expenses and materials
  • Perform other related duties as assigned
  • Help maintain cleanliness of vehicles
  • Effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines
  • Support other Mobile Service technicians and Tesla Service Centers as needed
  • Daily regional travel
Requirement
  • Knowledge of methods and techniques in the maintenance and repair of vehicles
  • Understanding and training on mounting and balancing tires and tire repair
  • Trade school training/ ASE’s a plus
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills as well as the ability to follow instructions
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work, including the public and multiple internal stakeholders
  • Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new systems, processes, and a dynamic work environment
  • Must be willing to become DOT certified
  • Experience operating a tow and trailer
  • Must be comfortable with daily regional travel and operating a large service vehicle
  • Must display a sense of urgency when responding to customer Roadside Assistance needs
  • Excellent customer service and problem-solving abilities
Compensation And Benefits

Compensation is based on a variety of factors including but not limited to work experience, skills, certifications, etc.

Full-time Employee Benefits

As a full-time Tesla employee, you will receive:
  • Full benefits from day 1 for you and your eligible dependents
  • Extended Health Insurance (including osteopath, psychologist, and acupuncturist)
  • Vision & Dental Insurance
  • Company paid Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability
  • Group Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
  • Employee Assistance Program, Sick and Vacation time (Flex Time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
  • Back-up childcare and employee discounts

title: Massothérapeute/ agent service clientèle
description:
Un emploi significatif dans un lieu de ressourcement et d'émerveillement, c'est ce que vous propose le Monastère des Augustines. Faire la différence auprès d'une clientèle à la recherche de repos et d'une expérience unique. Notre établissement patrimonial proposant déjà un service de restauration, un musée et des services en santé global, est à la recherche d'un ou d'une massothérapeute.

Si vous êtes autonome, chaleureux(euse) et souriant(e), vous êtes le ou la candidat(e) que nous désirons.

Le poste à combler est à temps partiel avec la possibilité d'effectuer plus d'heures selon l'achalandage.

Prenez note qu’au sein de notre entreprise, la clientèle est très importante, mais les employés et les collaborateurs le sont aussi. De ce fait, pour remercier nos collègues, nous offrons des conditions avantageuses, une ambiance unique et des rabais internes et autres.

N’attendez plus et joignez-vous à notre belle équipe!
  • Massothérapeute diplômé avec expérience
  • Membre d’une association professionnelle et pouvant émettre des reçus pour fins d’assurance
  • Détenir une assurance responsabilité professionnelle
  • Expérience de travail au service à la clientèle
  • Sourire, polyvalence et attention à la personne
  • Hospitalité
  • Sens de l’adaptation développé
  • Fiable
